Fries were good but cheese fries were nasty, regular fries tasted like they have no salt on them but have a good texture. chocolate shake is kinda weird and has a powdered chocolate (think Ovaltine) texture. so I'd give it 3/5!

RIRBIj7VtvNGDZ8UpWmbPQ.text: Yeah it was super hyped up but it held up. Very juicy and delicious burgers. For their opening day their execution was on point so a pat on the back to the staff. Burgers came out hot and well made, I had the double Shack cheese burger add onions and pickles. Had the bacon cheese fries which were good as well.

cfYbF4Ys1whs5haE8dTZPw.text: I was very confused of all the hype about shake shack until visiting. I've had "Inn&Out" and "Shake'n'steak" and "Freddy's" and I can say this is definitely as good if not better than the three. We went a few weeks after opening on a Sunday afternoon. The line was out the door but just to the curb. It was a quick line. I ordered a single cheeseburger with a strawberry shake and cheesefries. All of it was delicious. The ch see fried have a liquidy sauce on them but not the strange jello kind you get on nachos at the ball game, much better, liquid gold. Shake was thick and creamy. Burger tasted great, soft bun and yummy sauce. It was very busy but we were able to find seats inside

Z4OHrRxlwueEBK76ZOluRQ.text: We visited the newer location today on Rea Rd for lunch.  Ann was our cashier and she was so cheerfully delightful.  I do not know what changed since our last visit which was to the Woodlawn store but WOW!  This was an amazing experience.  I ordered the Double Shack with loaded fries and my partner had the Shack-cago Dog and the Chicken sandwich.  We split the dog and it was very good.  My burger.  O.M.G.  Nothing compared to the last one. This baby was juicy, flavorful and worth the whole $7.99.  I was blown away.  The fries were a hit as well.  Yummy cheese sauce topped with bits of cooked-just-right bacon!  I had to have a bite of the chicken as well.  This did not disappoint.  The breading was crispy and the whole muscle chicken breast seasoned perfectly.  Lots of mayo, just how we like it.  We finished it with a Concrete which was equally as good.  This location is about 1.5 miles from my house so we will definitely return. On my next visit, I promised myself I would order the Spicy chicken sandwich.  Might have a burger too because they are so damned good!  Well done, Shake-Shack!

PsUJRCjywbeD1KkasZbZnw.text: I knew this place going to open couldnt wait to try  it however I we t to NYC an ate there first.  Great burgers an cheese fries.  Wait was not long very impressed.  But the one in charlotte they will need to get it together before I go again.  The line was out the door the design of the place is backwards.  In NYC the line is inside.  We orderedI saw a table empty had my friend sit so I waited fir our food.  I was getting drinks an a lady in front if me said they are out of ice an she asked the young lady behind the counter, the employee said she get ice in the cup she handled just odd.  Mind you nobody was filling up the machine with ice an there had to be 10 of us tryin to get ice.  Than there mustard an ketchup      Station both mustard pumps were out.  I told an employee an the young lady said both ketchup are full.  Bless i want mustard she finally changed the bags thank goodness. So after most have there food than what looked like the manager came out wiped a table or 2 an put ice in the ice machine SMH if they want to stay busy I suggest they figure out how to keep things filled an the line down.  I think if times square can keep the food coming out quickly than charlotte can surely fix the problem. I cant say ill go back until its  more organized but a good burger much better than theres is HOBOs in fort mill  .

jMTZLGWZ7Qyt88iHV-q_dA.text: I'm a fan of the food, so I'm more patient than normal here but the Customer Service is awful. When I walked up to the counter, the staff is in the kitchen chuckling and having a good time. No one acknowledges a waiting customer. Then a girl finally strolls over to the register to take my order after I made eye contact. In the same breath that she's taking my order she pulls her phone out and starts TEXTING!!! I simply ordered one chicken sandwich with no mayo. It confused the hell out of her. She asked, no tomatoes? The sandwich doesn't even come with tomatoes! After I repeated myself five times she finally got it right. Then I asked for honey mustard and she was like it's around the corner. It wasn't. Only regular mustard was around the corner. TBH, I'll probably go back but if she's at the register I will kindly turn around to go across the street to Chick-Fil-A.

YHMay732GJZSuIAnvX68ZQ.text: I was in line for grand opening day an hour before doors opened at 11am. I was at the register at 11:45am! Not a bad wait with around 100 people in front of me. Quick turn around. After ordering, the food was ready after 5 minutes of waiting. They were greatly staffed and energetic, I was impressed! The restaurant was very chill calm, organized and not hectic even with a large customer audience. Burgers were just as flavorful and juicy as their other Shake Shack's I've been to in Manhattan. I went with a single shack burger, fries, and a shark attack concrete. It was all awesome. Great service. Great food.

-SxlbX8eIIgkhvrhUGhLBA.text: After a night of drinking with the boys. We decided to check out Shake Shack. We pull up to a modern and jazzy spot in one of Charlotte's hottest neighborhoods. Once we get in I thought the line was going to be long because it's a new spot and if Charlotte doesn't do anything else. It's a city that loves to eat. I ordered a tasty bacon cheese burger with cheese fries but the cheese on the side. Biting in to the burger was amazing. I was shocked. It was juicy and flavorful. I should have added lettuce, tomatoes, and onions. Live and learn. The fries were hot and the cheese sauce was good. Give it a try yourself to see what the rave is about.

dAXP3gAFGMkY7hGLhMSmvQ.text: New, shiny, and slightly overrated, but just slightly.  Falling in line with the likes of other chain, counter order, fast and casual spots is Shake Shack. Many people are familiar with Shake Shack and if you're not, then you should know it's the East coast version of In-and-Out and If you don't know what In-and-Out is, then you need to get out more.  The shortcomings. This location is shiny, new, and apparently pretty hard to keep clean. After being open for a couple of months, I expected things to have settled down and working like a well-oiled machine. Even when it's not too crowded, you will wait a fair amount of time for your order.   If you've been to one Shake Shack, you've (pretty much) been to them all. If you only get one thing off the menu, make it the blueberry concrete that mixes their custard with locally sourced blueberry pie from Suarez bakery. It is worth every single damn calorie.   Prices are Shake Shack prices, so don't expect a super great deal. Burgers are fairly small and honestly the fries taste like fried, frozen French fries, but that shouldn't stop you from demolishing a tray of them.  It's good, no doubt about it. When you want a step up from fast food burger and fries, it will certainly hit the spot, just don't expect the experience to be a step up. Solid 4/5.

3ylN0mhC0xnechEyXvPaxA.text: I'm very used to Shake Shack. They have several in NYC that I frequented on too many occasions for me to count. The people of Charlotte were so excited to get one and I was excited for them lol. I went a few weeks after they opened. There was plenty of parking and a nice amount of seating on the inside and outside. I ordered the shack burger a side of fries and drink. This place is not like your average fast food place. Come prepared to spend at least $15 on your meal. It's pretty good quality so that makes it worth the price but it's not something I eat every week. It's more like a treat lol. Definitely have to try the dessert. They are always changing up flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

I would never stand in line for this place ever.  It's very expensive for what you get.  Bacon cheese burger small fry and small drink was $14 and the burger was very small. It was good but very small. For this price I will go over to Duckworths and get a much larger burger and tastier in my opinion.

UHDhk1UxhMwz88lPFGRHLQ.text: Shake Shake, the upgrade Adult version of Steak and Shake!   Burgers are great, good size with an option to make it a double. Burgers have nice thick cuts of pickles on top, with crisp lettuce and tomatoes.   Fries are crinkle cut, and come out nice and crisp. With sprinkles of salt that hit the creases just right.  The shakes are Amazing!  A meal for one will cost you between $10-15 for burger/fry/drink. With a shake will be a little more.  Great for date night, relaxed environment.

aHi3BGjH0CU7PE5gptHRrA.text: The Shake Shack is fast food. It's burgers and fries and ice cream. The people are friendly. It's a popular choice for the neighbors. However, I find that for the price, it's nothing special. The food's not bad, but for what you pay...I'd expect more.

RmuuYfDF6auoXH2wKXWaAg.text: I went to the location in Atlanta and loved It. Here was no different. I've already made my sentiments known about the food so I won't rinse and repeat.  I will, however, repeat the complaining about the seating - or lack thereof.   This place has been packed since opening day. Standing in a long crazy line in whatever weather Mother Nature decides to bestow on us. Whether it's pouring rain or sweltering heat, You wait in long lines outside the door just to order food. Once your order is in, it's another battle finding seating. Obviously if the lines are long, tables will be packed as well. If you're in a large group, good luck finding a seat for your entire party. But let's say you find a seat - whatever you do, you can NOT leave that seat without someone holding the table. People stand around with trays of food, searching for a table and once it's open, there are several folks waiting to grab your spot. I saw a lady with an infant who got up to grab a booster seat, and when she returned, another couple took her spot. The confrontation that followed... awkward...   Limited seating is the only reason for losing a star.

uEn_SNCa2KJOLBzG9PiQmQ.text: Good lunch spot. Busy, that should tell you something. Ive visited the chain in DC, same quality came down 85. Parking could be better, the Park Rd shopping center was hectic before Shake Shack arrived.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shake Sauce

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great outdoor atmosphere. The bistro lighting outside makes it great for night time.

We've been twice now and both times lines were long and everything we ordered was right. Pro tip: don't sleep on the chicken sandwich! It may be even better than the burger. It's crunchy, ranchy, has just the right amount of pickles. I'm craving it just typing this review. Order it with a side of their cheese fries and roll out of there smiling. One day, I'll have enough room for a custard. One day.

_85sV6LjJHotQzyLTA6RdQ.text: 8th visit. Order has not even been remotely correct a single time. Have been promised a call from their manager twice now. Nothing.

Tn-K6hFqub2c6_NsVV3qaQ.text: Let me keep it funky with y'all on this one. This place is OVERRATED and OVERPRICED. It's not that it's not good, because it is, but for the hype I was expecting mouth changing orgasmic food. I can get similar foods from various places. If I want crinkle cut fries, American Deli does that. For a good flatop burger you can go to Mr. K's, Zacks, or even.....Smash Burger. Even the concrete is essentially run of the mill soft serve ice cream and cookie butter you can get from Trader Joes. They are able to overprice the food because of the name and following.   Again, I'm not saying this place isn't good for what it does and it may sound like I'm ragging on it, but I just want to be one of the few that gives a different realistic opinion from the masses of "It's Amazing".

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Double SmokeShack burger with fries and a Cookie butter concrete.

VBBt7zUdX1btevqNRZzs0g.text: The question to be asked about Shake Shack is not "Is it good?" (it is) but rather "Is it worth it?" In my opinion, the answer to that latter question leans ever so slightly towards no. The food is delicious for sure - juicy burgers; soft, buttery buns; unique sauces; and big flavor combinations. However, the high-quality taste isn't enough to offset the $15 price tag and small portion size for me, especially since the fries and the shake I also purchased were pretty average - typical fries, a typical shake. I do plan to return, but not often, and if I do, I might opt out of fries and definitely will opt out of a shake. The burgers are what shine at Shake Shack.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

XIILrxRGD0vBKxQetGmONg.text: High prices, high expectations. Got a meal for 2 and we're at $30. Boy, this better be good.   We got the Smoke Shack, Shake Shack, 2 Fries, a Pie oh Boy, and a 50/50. Let's go down the list and talk about how each was!  Smoke Shack: this was my burger and hmmm I didn't love it with my first bite. It was drenched in sauce and for some reason was extremely sour. I think it was sour because of the red pepper maybe?  Beef patty itself was salty.   Shake Shack: 10/10 would recommend! Your typical cheeseburger with a flair.   Fries: Never really liked crinkle fries til' I tasted theirs.   Pie oh Boy (Blueberry Pie): Rich and creamy and very pie-like.   I'm still extremely excited that Charlotte is getting up there in joints that only appear in big cities. Love this city!

8G4VKofDgOdJ-_OtxZPjxg.text: I waited over 46 minutes for my custard. It was 10 pm and not crowded. They apparently ran out of vanilla but did not tell me and let me wait that long. Also jipped me on the cookie butter.

6Ctrrd8qRYr_L1i9yYvviw.text: The excitement about shake shack in charlotte is crazy and please believe all the hype. I always loved going up north or down to Florida and making it my priority to get shake shack, and these location is just as great! First the burgers are amazing. My fav is the shake stack...an already delicious cheeseburger but with a fried stuffed mushroom on top! It is EVERYTHING! Get extra shakesauce, you won't regret it! A close second is the smoke shack, that chopped cherry pepper is the secret weapon!  I must say, I usually focus on the burgers and the perfect bacon cheese fries. I can't wait to venture off the menu and try the chicken, hot dogs and very tempting shakes!  Please not, it's still new and long lines are usual. I like to go on a weekday around 4:30 when I get off work. After 5 you'll get a short line. After 7 go ahead and prepare to wait.

mG7Fj4bpYNYXciZT09Kw2A.text: So glad I finally made it to Shake Shack to see what all the hype was about! I went on a Wednesday at 2pm for a late lunch and fortunately didn't have a line. On first impression, I was surprised at the price of the burgers. For some reason, I thought they would be more "fast food" priced. I got a burger, chicken sandwich, fries and concrete. I've heard really good things about the mushroom burger and may try it next time. The chicken sandwich surprised me, very tasty and nice and crispy. The crinkle fries won me over in a heartbeat. And the concrete, oh the concrete. SO DELICIOUS! I could eat that all day. They had two flavors to choose from (a cookie dough toffee or chocolate one). The toffee cookie butter was delicious. I'm already dreaming about another one!

4zgAEyy9cy5hmQyOM-HY0w.text: Its good, dont get me wrong but the hype around this place is just a little much as are the prices. After all, this is not NYC.  I give them credit for tying into local business via the desserts and craft beers they offer. I had the cheeseburger with the mushroom burger on it and would completely order it again if I was to go back. If i do, I wont be waiting in line again. The buger mushroom is stuffed with cheese then breaded and deep friend. The cheese fries were decent. But overall the price for a meal (burger, fries and a soda) was too high for what they serve. Afterall its not Kobe beef they are serving.

bVhskeT1TOYGFI33tPHD1A.text: SMOKE STACK.  review done!  But seriously have you tried the smoke stack?  Long lines be damned, that burger is good and well worth the wait.  Im not a big fan of shakes in general but if i am going to have one, it's coming from shake shack.   I truly have had dreams about that burger, and after trying other west coast chain burgers (I wont mention the name)that people try to compare Shake Shack to, it's blaspheme.  There is no comparison!  Shake Shack is best....and those cheese fries though!  All that's missing is a rewards programs for us True believers.  What's good Shake Shack?!

NX6fl8f75fOcZMcfoXjtOQ.text: I like McDonalds for what it is, OK food-cheap-fast, Shake Shack is about twice the cost and it's twice as good. Shake Shack won't replace Bang Bang, Bad Daddy's or another gourmet burger place, but it's not as expensive either. I also like Five Guys, about the same price point as Shake Shack, but Shake Shack is a little better in my view with a little broader menu. If you want better than McDonalds (about $15 for 2 adults) without spending Bang Bang/Bad Daddy prices ($45 for 2), you'll like Shake Shack ($30 for 2) and it's a little better than Five Guys. Shake Shack has a limited menu, but they have limited beer and wine choices.

V7BKBrGZClWO0kksrEX5Hw.text: Such a let down, especially after waiting in a huge line. My husband and I were major Shake Shack fans when we lived in NY. I wish I could say it was just as good as it used to be but to be completely honest, the food was terrible. I got the shackburger with no cheese. What I was given was a sad, unseasoned piece of meat with a wilted piece of lettuce and two bland tomatoes. For some reason they left off the onions and pickles? I don't even think they seasoned or salted the meat. It just tasted like burnt, grizzled meat. I'm not one to be dramatic about food but it was so bad that I ate about 3 bites and threw it away. The fries were good, but its pretty hard to screw up crinkle fries. I realize i'm in the minority with all these positive reviews but I wonder how much that has to do with the novelty of it.  Hopefully they step up their game.

dL9nGObBJHiQGLpxvoKb1A.text: Went there with my mans, we liked it!! They should have the outside part covered in some spots with umbrellas or something, it has a really classic burger joint vibe!:)

Ra66UnPxRo9mHETJH4JtAg.text: Oh my gosh. GO HERE!! Seriously was blown away by this place. I know it is a chain but tastes so local and fresh! Will probably be a new go to for sure.

1Bi-FS2MDTIzXDkehji9Eg.text: It was good, but the line was ridiculous and so was the wait after we ordered. It's just a burger place, and Five Guys has better burgers.

m5kpmkJbgls6_nsiYs3VKA.text: Everyone was talking about this new place so my family and I decided to try it out last Monday on a Memorial Day. I was warned that the wait would be long so I prepared for that. I was happily surprised that we did not have to wait in a long line but our order did take longer to make than the competitors. The atmosphere is clean, open, modern and there is plenty of outdoor seating available. The burgers were good (noticeably salty) but ordinary. The fries were crinkled fries which I like, but again they were also ordinary. I thought for sure the pazzaz would be found in the shakes, but again they were ordinary. So for $60 for a family of four, I didn't feel the need to come back, but I did enjoy trying something new. I liked the presentation of the burgers in a throw back paper around the burger, as well as the cute bag they put the food in. But overall the food itself was ordinary.

VZ7F984MOJeLd55XVreT8g.text: If you want a good quality burger go to shake shack! When I eat a burger I always use a good amount of ketchup to add flavor. This burger did not need any ketchup. From the first bite this burger was amazing! I will be back.

YqWjraqvoQIlVJyux-eEEA.text: Amazing! Food was great and Allison went out of her way to make sure we enjoyed our food, definitely recommend (Shake Sauce is A M A Z I N G)

3jbPAB136CY3h-HSrd3LwQ.text: The food is amazing, the service is so fast and very impressive. The employees were very nice and we were given free custard. I'm very very happy with my experience and will definitely be coming back!!

JbUucfev_vc5PgxAVH6nVw.text: Like everyone else, I had to see what the hype was about regarding Shake Shack. I had a late night burger craving and missed the crowd, arriving between 9-10pm. It only took a few minutes to order our food and we waited around 10 minutes to receive it once ordered. We both ordered the shake shack burger with our own custom toppings and included the shake shack sauce. With fries and large drinks, we spent around $30.00 for two people. Eh, on the price. I was impressed both with the presentation of the burger and taste! The shake sauce is definitely a must try, at least on the side if you're skeptical. The fries were crispy and hot and the burgers ingredients tasted fresh. Do I think what I received is worth $30.00, I would air on the side of not really; however it's an experience you have to try at least once. If I ordered shakes with my meals I would say yes! I made the mistake of not trying their shakes my first time around, I won't make that mistake my next go round but I have no doubt this isn't the last shake shack has seen of me!

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Custom Shake Shack Burgers w/ Crinkle Fries.. love the shack sauce!

LsRbtPM3HYQR66YFCieccA.text: The food is amazing and the French fries taste great and everything taste great.we even brung home the French fries so we can eat.we got 2 hamburgers which were AMAZING!!!!!we got a milk shake and delicious French fries!!!!!!

UO1Vlegrj9KufmTUgHZY9A.text: The food was ok. The restaurant is beautiful. The staff was awful. When arriving early for an online order I was told they could not go ahead and make the food, they didn't offer to go ahead and give me a drink. After watching people who arrived 15 minutes after me receive their food in under 5 minutes I clearly did not understand what the issue was with making mine early. The pump for the ketchup was broken and left a mess. When trying to show my screen to verify my order instead of shouting my number across a loud kitchen, the cashier insisted I continue to yell. Overall everything except the staff was great.

WH2c5zRTOVGCQeGyoFq9Sg.text: A good place to eat, I was not thoroughly impressed for what I got for my money. Would I eat there again? Yes. Would it be the first place on my list? No.

nzDW0PiGf1Fvrc6OIClX5w.text: There will never be a time where Shake Shack disappoints. Even will lines out of the door, service is fast,  efficient and overall impeccable. It is obvious that workers care about their customers which is always appreciated. The food alone is outstanding- I would recommend to anyone!!

ra91QlHr5L2m0Jz2NkSJUg.text: I honestly don't see what the big deal is. It was good but it wasn't like, "HOLY SHIT, THIS WAS THE BEST FUCKING HAMBURGER I HAVE EVER HAD!!!! ...It wasn't bad but it wasn't worth the 30 min wait. The fries I can get in the frozen section at HT, the hot dog was dry, the smoke shack burger was pretty good, the Chick'n Shack was ok..they forgot the lettuce and tomato and was bland. Good luck trying to get a refill or anything from the guy at the counter..Would I go back..yes, maybe if there's no line..but I just don't understand the drink-the-kool-aid type cult that this place has. Brooks in NoDa is WAY better. If you want a real hamburger and real cheese fries (With Chili)..go there

GyIeA-5JUGOzRSRJz6Y0nQ.text: Amazing food--especially the strawberry shake! Definitely a wait due to newness, but overall they have their systems up and rolling well. Can't wait to go back.

b2_WH3lty7RebWp_N7ZdfQ.text: Made a mistake and thought the shroom burger was a mushroom burger like a burger topped with mushrooms. But it was a stuffed fried portobello mushroom.  It was delicious.

mvkqV0KwHI3TDBv2jbtUHg.text: So I had Shake Shack for the first time in Vegas and it was OK.  Then it made it to Charlotte and we went for the first time and the line was still out the door, however, the line moved fast and great customer service.  I would agree that the burgers are a bit pricey and I'm not a fan of their shakes (but that's because I prefer real ice cream and not custard).  I saw a review about their veggie burgers and I'd be open to trying one upon my next return.  Lastly, I wouldn't rush to return, but it was a good night out as we sat outside and enjoyed our meal.

rLBuOI6z5UKPdKvgX2qCUg.text: My kids love this place!!! It's pricey Babur the food is fresh, facility is nice and the line is out the door but the environment is free flowing

8yKiP5uiSKfb81AibHNAHw.text: I am a huge Shake Shack fan and I was actually planning on moving out of Charlotte until I saw that they were opening one here. The food is great! The line can be a little long but that's to be expected with such a great restaurant. I do have one major complaint though... I didn't really care for the conversation happening between the young ladies ahead of me in line. These girls are having some serious relationship problems with their loser boyfriends. I don't know if it's like a weird daddy issues situation or if they just have low self esteem but they either need to get their personal lives in order or KEEP THEIR DRAMA OUT OF SHAKE SHACK! Save that nonsense for Taco Bell!

RtBjmzWwGVdkQoT4OMhyGA.text: This place is overrated. Bang Bang burgers is way better and I would have to say Five Guys is as well. Not worth the wait. The food was good but not as good as the hype.

CeBqk-gbVBj_A5UHdUW5Bw.text: I'm not too sure what the hype is all about. The first time I tried it, got the burger and cheese fries...the cheese fries I thought were good, but the burger didn't have much flavor. It's nothing that I would need to stand in line for or go out of my way to eat. I recently was driving by and decided to give it another try & get the chicken sandwich instead...once again, nothing special & kinda bland. There are way better places to eat in Charlotte for burger and chicken sandwiches.

otIQ3j4xeIyPd9CRMfEMMg.text: Pretty good, but the lunch line at 11:30 stretched halfway around the building. Had the single burger and fries.  Lemonade was good too.

ewYKCfZc0WWvkkpbCirNnQ.text: Shake Shack is fine, but that's it. It seems to be powered by hype alone. It's burgers aren't bad, but if you've had 5 Guys or Smash Burger there's no need need to bother with Shake Shack unless it's nearby. You probably want to try it for yourself anyways, so at least don't wait in a ridiculous line for it.

3VaVr2TQDd9QXoRW50pxVA.text: So happy to have this location in Charlotte. .. centrally located in the Park Road Shopping Center. Just as good as the ones I remember from out of state

VOTSdS_EB4-Y04bH7WHGKA.text: As a delivery driver, I've stopped here many times to pick up orders for customers and always admired how good the food looked. I finally decided to try it for myself and I was not disappointed! The crinkle fries were nice and crispy and had the right amount of salt. The cheeseburger had great flavor. I really liked that they actually serve handmade patties and not frozen ones. I haven't tried any of the shakes yet, but I'm sure I won't be disappointed. I thoroughly enjoyed my lunch there.

nPmaAcGq8ArpVN6_YElLhQ.text: Nice atmosphere! Basic burger! Quick dine in place. I'm underwhelmed. Expected a lot more. $30 for 2 burgers 3 fries 1 hotdog and 3 drinks. Kids meals aren't on the menu. But kid friendly.

17p4Pdha1gdao4r5U2urkA.text: I have to say I'm disappointed. I love a good burger and the fact that one of the most hyped burger joint in the country was opening up right down the street was huge. I didn't go right away when it opened, but finally after a few months I was able to go. After waiting 40 minutes in line on a Wednesday at 2:00pm, I was able to order. The prices definitely surprised me for what I thought was a fast food style burger spot. I got a double burger, fries and chocolate shake and ran me $18! The quality does NOT live up to that price. It's very similar quality to 5 guys and the shake was nothing special. It costs extra just to get whipped cream. So all in all very disappointed. If you want an overpriced burger that really is nothing special, and want to wait quite a while to get it, then this is your spot. For me I'll just go to one of the other much better burger spots at that price around Charlotte.

ae8Ch9QEV2ojrfZiFBE6sg.text: The chick n shack has a different batter than other shake shacks. This was really disappointing to eat, and the batter tastes like cornmeal. I'm giving it two stars because of the great ambiance.

VBYogaEbF4aBeNyx-rvv1A.text: It's good, but I wouldn't say wrap around the building let's go nuts good.  It's a burger place with prices that are more inflated than a normal burger place.

lEicEESoVFSeF0-iYGQQew.text: This location needs a manager. There is no reason for what is happening at this restaurant.  Makes me not want to go back. There are too many other places to go.

UmV-miw2R2zS14zoNSDA8w.text: Terrible service.  Took 45 minutes to get my food and there wasn't even that many people when I got there!

RtQV4ivfa9uVsP7Nb2nwUA.text: Okay the wait is definitely worth it especially for the shakes and burgers!!! The burgers are so good especially the shake sauce! Once we placed our order we only waited about 10 minutes or less for our food to come out.   My only negative comment is that the fries leave much to be desired. I don't even think they used a hint of salt on them. BUT, my strawberry shake was amazing and once we got inside the line moved fairly quickly. They have a large outdoor patio and plenty of seating on the inside!

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

TLgyHTQeKtryew22znxXRw.text: I've been to Shake Shack a couple times now and the experience has been consistent which I really appreciate. I learned pretty quickly that there is no need to get fancy here, order the ShakeShack Burger (add pickles) with a side of fries. This original combo is definitely a winner.   The menu has a lot of options, and it's set up on the wall when you first walk in. You order at the front counter and then sit--they'll buzz you when it's ready. The Shake Shack sauce is great, love it on the crinkle fries.  I agree, it's a little pricey for a burger and fries - but it comes down to quality, and you know you're getting a good meal here.

cqiQ4CwxPVt9QhcKYPRERw.text: Best chicken sandwich I ever had, sorry Chick Fil A. If your only eating the burgers you are missing out on the best item on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

Ky1DYtZDCQJNJQSqeYw9pg.text: So finally made it to First Charlotte location. The burgers were seasoned well and the fries were also fried perfectly and crispy. They  shake shack sauce is tasty look like thousand island dressing but doesn't taste like that at all.  I went on a Monday and lines were that bad. The cheese for the cheese fries wasn't the greatest and clumped up kind of quickly. They have different burgers and they also offer hot dogs and chicken sandwiches.  The restaurant is very casual and they have a patio that is dog friendly. Their milkshakes and ice cream are also very popular.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

wFWpy_NE307-RwGIdhzmyw.text: They are good at what they do...  Memories of BurgerChef...  lol.   Service is usually fun and helpful...  Food is consistent and good! #craveworthy  You have friends at Burton's

qTq6F-MXgwY2jnKCZxmkOA.text: Completely opposite experience this second time going there, in a great way! Wow. Really pleased with everything - cleanliness by the drink machine and condiments, customer service was excellent, tables were clean, food came out quickly and hot. All around great experience and will be back. The manager incentivized us to return with money off meal and it worked as it was a much better dining experience. Fries were crispy and hot, shake shack burger was really tasty, added onion and pickles. We will return. Give them a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

Irs12Sft__j-SPOzQCPeVw.text: I love this Shake Shack! This is my second time visiting this location in a week. I am not a huge fan of burgers but I have it a try. Let's just say this is the only burger I like lol When I entered this location I was greeted and the customer service was superb. The store is very nice and clean. The location is ideal because you are able to enjoy a good meal and enjoy the shops around.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

hRePJ_YZprMvZLbkM1Qxkw.text: Our first time here and we absolutely loved it! The ambience is laidback and casual but still great! The cheese fries is a must! One of our top burger joints in Charlotte! Def coming back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. The cheese fries are amazing!

pCsuLx0YKCQIY5FP4r97CA.text: Went a couple of times and got turned off by the line. Hopefully, at the time of writing this review, the lines have subsided... hopefully.  I've had Shake Shack at the original location in Manhattan and it was great there, and then had them in upper east side and in Boston, and they're still good but tough to pay for at this price for burgers and fries once you've had it a few times. Great to take people who haven't tried Shake Shack yet, so they can add to the neverending debate of best burgers around the country. I think I'm an In-n-Out guy, so take that for a grain of salt.

ZHd_R0oUI9w52GOTMwxpnA.text: Love the fresh burgers and crinkle cut fries. Always friendly always clean. Great coffee milkshake too.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

Sqeu8s_WKZjFyrUJ4o-0Sg.text: This place is always crowded, but the line to order moves fast.  The burgers were juicy and delicious.  Best part is that they serve beer!    The reason I'm giving a lower rating was due to service.  We were given a buzzer to let us know when the food was ready to pick up at the counter. It never went off. We weren't worried because it was so busy.  Then someone in the restaurant was walking around to find us and we finally spotted him carrying what looked like our order. It had set on the counter and then carried around on hot the patio.  The kids were disappointed that their milkshakes were runny.  Our fries were cold and burgers lukewarm.   Probably better to carry out and wait.

3j9jmJUbE8uEiAgoYZdyNg.text: So this is one my favorite places to go in NYC and to be honest I liked the idea that it was a special treat when I traveled. I didn't want to go during the rush of people.   The location is strong but parking in the park road parking lot is always crazy. The space is big and seemed clean. The employees were friendly! The line wasn't super long and we waited about 10 minutes for our food.   I got the bacon single burger with pickles. The burger was juicy and the pickle slices were pretty thick. We also got bacon cheese fries. I'm not the biggest fan of the cheese but the bacon bits were delicious!   They don't have combos so be prepared to order everything separate. Overall the quality is solid but still the hype was too much I think. It's good to go if you are in the mood but it's not out of this world. I have had the milkshakes in NYC and they are pretty darn good, didn't try it here though. Definitely a place to try out but it's not a go to for me.

k1VnoUpFxE4Xp2OuV8i64g.text: It isn't that I don't like this place, it's that it isn't worth the hype. My first time having Shake Shack was in DC and I remember liking it but thinking it didn't exceed Five Guys. With that said, it was good so we were looking forward to it coming to CLT. We went a few months after it opened, hoping to have avoided the crowds. We were wrong. It was super crowded and busy. I ordered a chicken sandwich and my husband ordered a burger. We both enjoyed our sandwiches. We shared the fries (which, honestly, I thought weren't too great).  My main issue here is how crazy it was. For as packed as it gets, I wish they arranged tables in a communal way where there weren't so many half tables being used while other people stood around searching for a seat. Additionally, the place was a mess, which is more of a reflection of the people dining there than the staff (come on people, we can clean up after ourselves). It also took about 15-20 minutes for our order to be complete, which seemed a little long.   In general, this spot is just okay to me.

3o1-e1aWHXWUQJ_Eo30Jjg.text: Update: after my initial visit and review, I received a message from Jake with Shake Shack, he let me know about the quality of ingredients. Jake shared "We have high standards for how we source our ingredients, choosing a proprietary blend of freshly ground, 100% all-natural Angus beef, which is served on a non-GMO Martin's Potato Roll and contains no hormones and no antibiotics. Our crinkle cut fries are made from Yukon potatoes that are free from the artificial ingredients that so many fries include. Likewise, our 16oz shakes are made with frozen custard that is spun daily at our Shacks. Our vanilla and chocolate recipes use only real sugar, no corn syrup, and milk from dairy farmers who pledge not to use artificial growth hormones."  Jake also provided me a card so I came back for a second visit. The gluten free bun and burger were good, and the crinkle fries were crisp and hot. The lemonade was also delicious.   It took a little more than 10 minutes from entering the line to getting my food.

pvKLBLZMSDlmCNoGS9q09w.text: A nice burger and a yummy shake! Definitely more expensive than your average burger place, but it's fun for a treat! Very easy to order online and pick-up, and in-store service has always been friendly and prompt.

XKSGhSmeV-_Yym3qugbseg.text: The only thing that needs to be said about this place is that it officially dethroned bang bang burgers as the best burger spot in Charlotte. The line isnt as bad as it looks. Go.  I recommend the regular shackburger and add bacon. If you are a big eater get the double patty. The single with fries was more than enough for me. Also got the cookie concrete ice cream.... Incredible. A must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shack burger with bacon and fries

jNdECqdAAMZ-RA_D20tkhA.text: Time to update my review! I finally decided to dine in at shake shack.  Honestly the only reason we decided to come was because it was the only place open at 11 am on a Sunday in the area.  Popped my friends Shake Shack cherry!  Right now their featured shake is cookies and cream. But there's more! You have it either chocolate, vanilla, or strawberry.  I had to go with the strawberry cookies and cream shake just because I was told it tasted like strawberry cheesecake.  It did not disappoint! It was even topped with vanilla Oreo crumbles. My only compliant about the shakes there is that I would like to be able to order it when I order my meal and then come back to the counter after I eat my meal and pick it up (like they do at Freddys) by the time I finished my meal and moved onto the shake, it was already melted and warm.  On to the food! I had the shack burger with fries and added onion. Friend had the smoked shack burger.  He really enjoyed his but we both agreed it wasn't worth the cost.  The patty was thin and over cooked. Nothing juicy about it.  I'm not a fan of their fries either. Thick Crinkle cut fries just don't hit the spot.  I'm sure I'll be back sometime and have just a burger. Oh, and maybe try a new featured shake!

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thin patty on the shack burger
Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shack burger and smoke shack burger
Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Featured shake, strawberry cookies and creme

YlQ49BL78OFFWS0DO2UBng.text: There's always a line because this place is that good. Occasionally a burger will be underdressed which I've only experienced at this location. That also means that Clt has the least consistent quality of any Shack I've visited unfortunately.  Service is fast and there's always someone swarming the dining room cleaning tables. The collaboration w Suarez Bakery on the Pie-o-My monthly pie/concrete mask up is genius.

LYF5a5Z7UDXXiilmLuHcQg.text: I absolutely love this place the quality is great do yourself a favor and order the cheese fries also I've never had such a good tasty and filling chicken sandwich heads up it does get busy here but it's worth it

JEC_oSouwYkyf9g0uv-_Yg.text: Very very upset. Went here to get a burger and my burger was raw not even cooked all they way. I have never had such a terrible experience here before. Not a very happy person.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Raw...
Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

SkBVm2GDbkTeUaaBD3Z5Wg.text: Prices way to high for these burgers. Tasted the same as steak&shake.   Not memorable to continue going to.

02rHvHvj41GyYVkYThGHfA.text: Great new addition to the community. The parking lot in front of the burger place is limited, but be encouraged you can park in the shopping center behind the place. You will get some of your steps in with the parking situation. I came on a Saturday early evening and it was packed. The line was out the door. I am all too familiar with the brand and quite enjoy their shakes. I got the regular burger with the shack sauce, fries, and a cookies and cream shake. The cookies and cream shake wasn't advertised on the regular or limited edition menu, but it's available.  The shake was great! I'll come back for more flavors. The burger was good but nothing special and the fries compliment the burger. The staff were working so hard to get the food out and turn over the tables, etc. it's busy now because it's new and the only one in the city. I am sure the excitement will die down and long lines will not be forever. It's a good place to get a burger and there are stores you can walk up nearby so location is prime. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

zabeGfGIlBBphUg8grg-VA.text: Shake Shack offers a delicious variety of nutritious foods. Additionally, Shake Shack offers a feeling of warmth and joys from a simpler time. The luscious buns compliment to crisp, fresh lettuce and the scrumptious, melted cheese. The toppings pair delightfully with the perfectly cooked burger patty. All together the burger touches tastebuds and tanins that haven't been touched in years. However, the burgers--while still being the work of art that they are--are extremely overpriced, and the service is mediocre. I will come again, but, personally, would have a much more enjoyable experience if the was a bit faster. That's all. End of review.

K--ZFp1OOmoVQRSroTrbqw.text: Good place, good burgers, everything is really good but the only thing i have to complain about is that there is NO RANCH.

kDqu7dyTT9gjEwrE_PmWBg.text: After all the hype of Shake Shack coming to Charlotte, I decided it was finally to check it out (hoping the lines died down by now). There was still a good sized line and we had to wait outside for a few minutes before getting a chance to look at the menu. I love the atmosphere of the building -- very modern and sleek. The service was wasn't terrible, but the cashier was not friendly at all and you could tell she more than didn't want to be there. There was one employee at the drink/condiment area keeping it really clean, which I overly appreciated because that area seems to always be the first one overlooked at a fast food joint. My boyfriend and I each ordered burgers, and a shake with a French fry to share. Totally like $26...seems a little over priced for what it is. The burger was good but it really wasn't very big. You could get better burgers at any neighborhood grill. I was also disappointed in the size of the milkshake for like $5 a shake. Was it good? Yes. Was it worth it? Not really.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

HrSIwJKfmc0_K6sRumyI9Q.text: Sorry SS. Still way too slow. Placed my order at 1:15 and it's now 1:35 and STILL waiting. 2 burgers and an order of fries should not take 20 mins. I just don't get why this place hasn't figured out how to be more efficient after being open now for almost a year.

NIoMXl9xKVcPHRueWsclpg.text: As someone that waited in line for over an hour when Shake Shack opened in Manhattan, I feel very confident posting this review about my experience in Charlotte:  Pros: line was out the door (standard), but only 10 minutes long, there was plenty of seating and that's about it.  Cons: the staff was pretty brutal. Despite being open for several weeks, the staff was disorganized, overwhelmed and seemed to be cutting corners and throwing food and drinks together sloppily.  My fiancee and I ordered two single shake burgers, two cheese fries and two shakes. The patties were average at best. The bun was soggy, there was barely any cheese on the burger, the cheese fries had little to no cheese and the shakes were nothing special.   We spent $31 which is typical for their menu, and sadly, I wish the food lived up to the billing. We noticed tons of people complaining about their food and often couples next to us not finishing their burgers, fries or shakes. This is very abnormal from my prior experiences in NYC.  Despite the long lines, which aren't really long compared to other large cities, the service and food does not justify us coming back.

sQuzte7pIBTC9jKWTALQog.text: Would you like some flies to go with that shake?  My last visit to Shake Shack was probably my last, at least until after fly season is over. There were flies everywhere.  The problem is that their doors stay open all the time because their ordering area is too small to accommodate a significant amount of people, so the line out the door holds the doors open for the flies.  The flies don't even have to wait in the line like everyone else; they just fly in and start eating. SS really needs to do something to address this unsanitary condition.   As for the food,  the burger was pretty good, but too small for the price. The chocolate shake was good, but pathetically small.  I can't believe that they only offer the shakes in what is essentially a kid's size when the place is called "Shake Shack". "Tiny Shake Shack" would be a better name. You can get a much better meal deal across the parking lot at the Soda Shop - better food, better quantity, better price, and a delicious, grown-up-sized shake.

7EsIdrtGjM75WLfFmVDgDg.text: Just as good as the New York locations. Great tasting burger and the concrete was gooood.  Since they're new in town and everyone is working furiously, the line moves fast. If you want to avoid lines, stay away after 5 on weekdays and all day on weekends until the novelty wears off. They also have an app where you can pre-order and cut the line.  Bottom line, enjoy the good burgers.

8l2aDyYmv4AdpN4IoiN-Qg.text: Yum. We finally went after the newness died down some. We had to see what the hype was all about.   The location is super cute and trendy in park road shopping center. Parking is crowded. But that's typical.  There was a quick moving line when we came in Friday night.  Their prices are high for what it is. We split a single burger, double burger and fries for about $18.    We had no problem finding a seat. The burger was super tasty. I understand the hype. It had a nice char/crust. Mine came without lettuce so I asked for some and they brought me a whole new burger and to keep the original. It was really no big deal. I was just looking for the green lettuce for some crunch.  I liked the vibe, the food, and the experience. We'll definately throw it in the rotation.

13FSSKUw1fWcteBOoLNqSA.text: When I saw Shake Shack was opening in CLT I was so excited. I am sure I am not the only one that would see their food all over Instagram & want to try it sooo badly. I went with my sister and her friend for a casual dinner & was surprised at my thoughts. First of all we had to wait in an EPIC line to even get in the restaurant - this is totally to be expected though as the restaurant was new. Once inside we ordered 3 sandwiches, 2 orders of fries and 3 milkshakes. I was taken aback when my total was a whopping $60 - all for burgers and fries. The food was good don't get me wrong but it wasn't everything I was hyping it up to be. Plus, paying NYC prices in the middle of suburban Charlotte wasn't ideal. It was good but I won't be rushing back

vYBeuBYRWj6XX3lKyJkhkw.text: Shake Shack... New York prices for ok food, you can definitely do better in Charlotte. Look, if you got a burger, fries, and a soft drink, you are in the $15 range after taxes. Is this burger and fries worth $15, honestly, no. There are plenty of "fresh patty" joints in Charlotte where you can get a decent combo for $10-$15 with more choices in toppings and customization.  The value proposition for what you get just isn't worth it in Charlotte.

LzpjXG5dw-E2s3pN6_LVDw.text: Omg this restaurant is amazing food was so fresh.. I was expecting this to be the average burger joint they exceed my exceptions & more will be back for sure !!!!

rM9ZE4IRxcxtH8um1mLIPg.text: The food was very good. I had the shack stack which had the portabella mushroom and cheeseburger and I enjoyed their fries a lot. The only thing I was surprised with was that the place only had 4 high chairs given number of people in there with small children. We have 18 month old twins and it was a bit of a struggle to find high chairs at first.  Also, it would have been nice to know that hot dogs would come charred (which I ordered for kids), given the lack of a kids menu (unless there was one I missed). Next time I would request for them not to char the kids dogs. If it was for me, the char would have been great, but that's not a favorite preparation for the kids.   All and all a good experience and we'll be back!

0QnEE77N0FszBKPf2DU3rA.text: $10.48 for cheap burger and Fries is wayyyyyy overpriced for what I got. Burger was way to greasy and low quality for what I paid. Never again..  Sticking to 5 guys

_eUz5ikb9ioVkNabZNiiQg.text: Finally tried Shake Shack today for the first time .. the verdict? If you're looking for an average tasting burger with decent crinkle cut fries and a mediocre shake for about 15.00 then you've found your place.. for less money there are just so many better places to get a burger and fries meal in Charlotte.. very disappointed..

jUGX-zlsREn5c3Sm7LnTIg.text: My favorite "fast food" burger place in Charlotte! I have been here twice here on my lunch break, and it was a great experience both times. The food was ready pretty quickly, and you're given a little buzzer to know when it's ready, so that you can go ahead and sit down while you wait.  My only real complaint is the way they designed the area by the drink machine, it's too small of an area for the amount of people that are getting drinks and/or passing through. The prices are a little high, but the food is worth it. Definitely tastes of higher quality than a cheaper burger restaurant. I got a Mocha Cookies & Cream milkshake today, and it was amazing. I ordered it without knowing the price, and was a little shocked when I saw it was almost $6, but it was definitely worth it. The best milkshake I've had!

NXl-559S_y_ghiMFKLysUA.text: Earlier this summer when they first opened there was a line out of the door every single day and I couldn't find a time when there wasn't at least a 20 minute wait. These days the lines have calmed down and I simply order from the app and go in and pick up my order. They almost always get my order correct and are friendly and courteous. The workers look like they are having a good time, but it errs on the side of unprofessional in some situations. Other than that, I love the food, the cleanliness, and accuracy with my order. I live around 45 minutes away from there but whenever I am close, I hop on the app and put in a order. It is my guilty pleasure. The shack stack is something special, truly unique and delicious. If you love fresh food fast with high quality ingredients I would highly suggest you stop by.

H-TF6x5BAtxLBr2wUwgA4w.text: I don't know if I'm here for the hype. Before coming here, I heard how it was the best fast food place hands down. I'm no connoisseur but I did find that hard to believe based on looking at the menu ahead of time. I will say this was the first fast food place that I noticed was a la carte and quite overpriced if you ask me, but I was still very excited to try because I wanted to know what all the ra ra was about. I will say it is in prime location and the environment is very casual and comfy. I always love that aspect when it comes to places..makes me feel right at home.  I ordered the shroom burger, crinkle fries, and a pie oh my concrete. I was excited because the pie concrete is based on seasonal flavors and also the proceeds go to a foundation of good cause. The seasonal flavor was blueberry pie and it was the best thing on my plate. The shroom burger was okay, definitely not disguised as a burger because the mushroom taste is very strong. The cheese within the burger is a bit much it caught me by surprise when I took a bite and scorching hot cheese was spot back at me. The only condiments they have for fries is cheese, yellow mustard, ketchup and I feel like within today's times people eat fries with so much more but could just be me. I spent 18 dollars on one meal which seemed like a bit much to me for a "fast food" meal especially when all I really enjoyed was the concrete. More power to the people that love this place but I will pass

Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

tzYYEy3rX3ccokw9VhhWLQ.text: Sorry no pictures but my burger was fantabulous! Bacon double cheeseburger hands down the best ever. And a Salted Carmel Milkshake was perfect. Awesome lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salted caramel milkshake kinda day!

PPlrDBSWxQv1IimdBNd4EQ.text: Idk if you guys will like this review because I know shake shake is a fav for many but it truly was just okay to me. While on a weekend trip in Charlotte I was so excited to finally try shake shack! I had been dreaming of this moment after seeing the deliciousness on IG. The first thing I noticed is that the prices were higher than I expected, but I know when the ingredients are a high quality things tend to go up. I ordered a burger, fries, and a drink.  The purchased a double shack burger with bacon and all the fixings. The burger was juicy, although saltier than what I like, the bun was perfect and the onions, lettuce, pickles, etc. seemed very fresh. The crinkle fries were amazing and came with a good amount.   I like shake shack and maybe I need to try the ice cream, but the burger was no where near the same amount of meat you get at a Five Guys and although the fries were great, you get a full greasy bag at Five Guys.  Overall, I would return to try something different but I will not be getting a ticket for a seat on the Shake Shack hype-mobile.

CH-kE1hl33sUTA4mrLmlGw.text: The best way to experience Shake Shack is with the mobile app ordering system. I feel like this particular location can be a bit on the slow side in terms of actually getting the food to the people. They work on a buzzer system, and there's usually only one person getting the food from the "ready" shelf to the people who have been buzzed that their food is ready. This can get a little backed up especially when there are multiple mobile orders ready to go.   Also be forewarned that this location is at Park Road Shopping Center which can be notorious for parking difficulties.   The food itself has always been delicious, and I want to come back to try some of their other menu items but I've always been a burger and cheese fries girl if I'm splurging my calorie intake for the week here.

Yz_tzKxniAJw5Ra9B_EaGg.text: This place is busy the quality is good and the quantity is small portion for the price I had twice at this place

aRD-nria9-pz1q0FRh4SUQ.text: I don't get all the bad reviews! I really enjoyed this place.   I stopped in on a Friday night right before the dinner rush so my wait was short. The cashier was kind and patient as I asked questions and ordered my food.   I ended up going with the ShackBurger and fries with a chocolate milkshake.   The burger was delicious! It was cooked up hot and fresh and had great flavors. I'd absolutely recommend this! The french fries are crinkle cut and delicious. I enjoyed them plain today but they also offer cheese and bacon which I might try next time!   The milk shake was so thick and yummy. I added whip cream...because what's a milkshake without it? And it added a nice touch. I'd recommend grabbing a spoon to enjoy it.   I also tried the hotdog with all the fixings. I really enjoyed it.   Everything was delicious! I can't wait to come back. I also can't wait to try using the app and grabbing a mobile order so I don't have to wait in line.

rOGbCy1JmdHSDJMz83ye3A.text: I absolutely love shake shack! This one just opened so it's incredibly busy and you have to wait for an insane amount of time, but it's definitely worth it. Our burgers were amazing and the Shake was so creamy and smooth. I will definitely come back here when it calms down a bit, but hopefully they will open more shake shacks in our area. One con: why don't they have peanut butter milkshakes year round??? That's the most popular milkshake!!

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

b-Zu1C-epMbuagxb8drjcg.text: 3 visits - 3 incorrect orders  1st time through, I asked for the fries to be 'light salt' and extra crispy (if possible) and was told by the cashier that would be no problem. When I received my order, I tasted a fry at the counter and it was super-salty. I asked the expediter to correct that, and he grabbed another basket of pre-prepared fries from the top of the line and handed it to me. I asked him to please get me fresh fries with lighter salt, and to possibly overcook the fries if possible, and was told that they "have to sell these fries". So I left disappointed, and decided not to order fries here again.  - The burgers were delicious, the fries; not so much.  2nd visit, ordered 3 burgers to go. Got home, and 2 of them were incorrect. There was a beef patty missing from one burger that was supposed to be a double, and the other burger was missing bacon. As the location is 20+ mins from my home, it wasn't worth correcting, and we just ate what we had, after sharing bacon out of another burger.  - The burgers were, as  above, delicious, but not what we ordered - or paid for.  3rd visit, yesterday evening. Last visit. As I was checking my order at the counter (prior experience told me this is mandatory), surprise! Once again, a double burger ordered was a single burger delivered. At that time another gentleman was complaining to the expediter that his chicken sandwich was undercooked, and showing that it was pink-ish in the middle. The expediter engaged him in argument stating that that's how it is cooked. When the gentleman asked for a new sandwich to be more thoroughly cooked, he was told that they would "cook 'em the same way", and the expediter was clearly resistant to correct the issue or empathize with the client. I wasn't about to head down that same road, so I took my overly expensive single burger, and left.  - Again, burgers were great, just not what I ordered or paid for.  Won't be back, they have at least $7 of my money for extra patties and bacon that they never made good on. They can keep it, I'll call it an inexpensive lesson.

dIAOwpv8YuWBh8oZzbfydA.text: I had never been to a Shake Shack until this year and OMG you guys...  I'm a die hard Chik-Fil-a fan and I feel guilty saying it but, the chicken sandwiches here are the best I've ever had.  I'm obsessed!!  We were going almost once a week for a while and the food is consistently on point.  My husband usually gets some kind of burger, I get the Chicken Shack with cheese fries.  I love the herby mayo and the plethora of pickles on the sandwich.  I looooove the cheese sauce on the fries - like I'm lactose intolerant, but it's worth it.  Even the hotdogs are legit.  Just go there.  Get one of everything and then die happy.  *Just a helpful warning: the place stays busy.  So it's on the slower side of fast food.  But be patient because it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Shake and Double Shack Burger with Cheese Fries.  Hallelujah.

uXtLWYfnkOJjrjFAZ-GHHg.text: We're fans and have been anticipating the arrival of Shake Shack to the Charlotte area.   When we arrived the line was all the way out the door and past the building. It took us 15 minutes to get to the cashier to order and then we waited about 15 minutes to get our food after we ordered. So a 30 minute wait all together wasn't that bad for me.  I went with the Chickn'Shack which was amazing. My only gripe was that I wanted more. To start I am a fan of potato rolls and bread. This bread is the perfect accompaniment for these sandwiches. The crispy battered chicken with the herbed mayo was perfect.   Since they don't have a kids menu my son went with the Single ShackBurger with ketchup only and he demolished it.    My hunny ordered the SmokeShack and it was good too. He let me take a bite. And then another when I asked for some more! LOL! The cherry pepper on the burger is not overpowering and balances out the smoky and saltiness from the bacon.   We ordered two fries - one plain, one bacon cheese fries. The fries themselves were good but not sure we order the bacon cheese fries again. At almost $5 they were skimpy on the cheese and bacon.   I really love custard but the custard here did not do it for me. It was just okay over all.   The lemonade was overly sweet. And that may just be our taste buds and preference. We had to water it down significantly in order to be able to drink it.   We'll be back. The burgers are made right and so are the chicken sandwiches.

lDe0q2d2cRbhRT-3vj-t_A.text: Nice alternative to the standard chain burger place.   We ordered a shake burger, BBQ bacon double burger, a chicken sandwich, a large concrete, a small ice cream(?), 1 drink, cheese fries, and BBQ bacon cheese fries. The total came out to about $46.  I've never been an extreme fan of five guys and living on the east coast my whole life I've never had a Whataburger or in and out so, that being said, shake shack currently sits atop the throne of chain-not-fast-food-but-not-restaurant burger spots. They don't do one specific thing very well but they do it better than the others(that I've had).  This location was very busy when we visited and that's due to the hype, which it seems a few people were affected by.. I'd suggest if you're visiting for the first time to tame your expectations.. it's not the second coming of Christ.. it's just a decent hamburger.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. When you live over 3 hours away, you&#39;ve gotta make it count

sFt5qt-wtTk4t60gmiMtJA.text: What even. This place blew me away and I don't even like hamburgers. But I love veggie burgers and Shake Shack managed to make a sinfully good (most definitely unhealthy) vegetarian option, which most fast food establishments desperately fail at - the Shroom burger.   Upon ordering, the lady at the cashier asked me if I'd had it before, basically warning me that it was just a giant fried portobello mushroom stuffed with cheese (no burger patty). As if that wasn't enough?? I also got one of the concretes, which is essentially frozen custard with mix ins. I decided on the Shack Attack, which is chocolate custard, fudge, cookie dough, chocolate chunks, and chocolate sprinkles. I love chocolate so this was good but a tad bit too chocolate-y.   The shroom burger is meaty with a crispy shell. Upon biting into it, cheese oozes out and it's heavenly. It didn't even need ketchup.  Luckily, I came at 5pm so there was no wait. They give you a buzzer after you order and I only waited maybe a minute or so before my food was ready. I'll be back for sure!

tw749U5Q3PG7GfpQZB4UTA.text: As delicious as everyone said it would be! My go to and my FAVORITE thing to get here are the cheese fries! The cheese burger with bacon is pretty good and the shakes are very rich and delicious. Overall, very tasty for a fast food burger joint!

WYu_whqDvgfVutF8CDQLKw.text: I've been to shake shack on opening day their food Is pricey but worth it I got the shack stack with bacon and Fries with shack sauce. They have a great patio and I recommend the pie o my shake

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZNSCT-GwKQ0Ev9Y2BbM0wQ.text: As a former resident of NYC, I couldn't wait for Shake Shack to open! Hard to believe we finally have one in Charlotte. Even on opening day, the quality of the food was just like in NY. My favorites are the Shroom Burger and cheese fries. It's a nice touch to have local beer options.   A few things to note for first time visitors. 1. It's fast food, but you can't think of it as fast food. The quality is much higher which makes it more expensive. Think of it like going out to eat. 2. There will be a wait. Just expect it. Even opening day I waited 30 minutes. In Shake Shack world, that's not bad. 3. They have an app now that you can order food in advance. Use it.   Great place! I highly recommend a visit!

Q4tNzieZFqnX_IRsKmhEjQ.text: Guys, we need to talk... about SHAKE SHACK!  Everyone and their brother have been beating the Shake Shack drum since they announced groundbreaking. As for me, I'm a big fan of local burgers but I'm open to friendly competition. After all, any opposition is either going to highlight better restaurants or force the homestead players to innovate and do better. Shake shack will definitely be ruffling some feathers with their remarkable burgers and high-quality ingredients.  I suggest you go in forgetting any prenotions that you've heard about the place. Just compare it to your favorite burger joint, hole-in-the-wall or upscale, doesn't matter. Everyone else has heard the good word already and the line is going to be unimaginable. I almost left when I pulled up on their second day open because the line was 3/4 wrapped around the building. I decided see how it was moving and to my surprise, they we're churning at 5-6 people a minute. Yeah, I'm game!  What made the wait even better was that they were giving out free samples to the peeps in line. I got to try the raspberry ginger lemonade and two different concretes before ordering, awesome! From the back of the line (estimate 110+ people) to the service counter was less than 25 minutes. It gave me plenty of time to choose my burger: Double SmokeShack with Lettuce & Tomato. The counter staff greet you with a "Hey, what's shakin'?!" and I thought it was cute and really breaks the ice nicely.  From the counter to walking out the door with my bag was maybe 5 minutes, great considering how busy it was. I unwrapped my burger as soon as I got to the car and took a moment to adore the perfect char on the outer rim of the patties. Seasoned perfectly, wonderful ShackSauce that is similar to just about any burger joint's "Special" sauce, only better. Fresh veggies and great proportions, and the BUN. Oddly enough the bun was slightly squishy/springy (imagine an Asian steamed bun, only starchier). It was the perfect vessel for such a great burger. Price-wise it was up there a bit, but it was one of the best burgers I've had from a restaurant in this neighborhood.  Fries were good, not "blow your socks off" but they had a consistent texture and flavor. Not surprisingly, they are definitely par cooked and frozen, and there's nothing really wrong with that, especially considering the size of the company. Once restaurant chains get bigger than a dozen or so stores, most go to the frozen route because otherwise they must test the sugar content of every shipment of potatoes that come in, per FDA nutritional reporting guidelines. That being said, they were really good fries. I wish I had asked for some extra ShackSauce to dip them in, but I got ketchup instead.  Long story short, don't let the lines scare you away. They are going to be slammed for the foreseeable future and have already built up enough rapport to commit to a second restaurant in the QC. It's a damn good burger, just make sure your schedule allows the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. 3 weeks in and still buzzin!
Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Omg...

AREuwM9GcbfZiabzMqd1lw.text: Shake Shack, Shake Shack, what's with all the hype around Shake Shack?  Well, for starters, they make a damn good burger and fries.   Stopped by here after the lunch rush on a break and finally got to see (and taste) what all the fuss is about. It's a nice building with lots of stainless steel design and huge windows for lots of natural light. When you walk up to the counter and order you get a little buzzer and when it goes off you can pick up your order from the kitchen window. I just ordered a simple hamburger and a side of fries but man were they delicious. You could tell the burger had been seasoned well, and it had those perfect little crispy edges you only get on a flat top. The insides of the bun were toasted (and lightly buttered?) to perfection but the outside was as soft as can be. This is easily in my top five burger at this point. Fries were, if possible, even better. They may be my favorite fries anywhere at the moment. Crinkle cut, incredibly crispy exterior but still soft inside and adequately salty. So, so good.  My only two minor complaints were time and price. It took a little longer than I expected for them to fire up a plain hamburger. Not incredibly slow, but enough to mention. Price being my other little hangup, a plain, no topping, single patty burger with a side of fries and no drink was $9. Now that's not too crazy given the quality, but two people dining with loaded two patty cheeseburgers, drinks and sides, you're really getting into sit down restaurant territory, not even counting if you want to try one of their shakes.   In conclusion I'm 100% sold on the quality. I don't know about all those crazy folks who waited hours in line when it opened, but it sure is yummy. Given the price and location though it might be more of an occasional indulgence for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch with my lady after her physical therapy appointment.
Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

CgRVggCOBn3Xhix1l5t_Vw.text: I had heard great things about this place, and so a friend and I decided to go there. The appearance was nice, and it was busy with millennials. It looked very clean.   We both ordered burgers; shared a cheese and bacon bits fries; and she had a strawberry shake while I found they had Fanta Grape, and I got that for a change.  Our burgers were "just ok". I mean I have had better burgers pretty much everywhere else I have been in my life. We each rated the burgers about 6/10. The Fanta Grape was good, and the strawberry shake was very good.  The fries? Ok, but somewhat unappetizing in appearance, and for a large order, they were actually quite small. I think I could lose weight eating those.  And the bill for that food? Over $28! Ridiculous! The millennials can keep this place. I am pretty sure I won't be back.

dgCAqBEs-XSNMXlECy6KFg.text: The hype is real!!! So the wait on this rainy opening night was still serious and the line was out the door at 9:30pm!!!   To start off I've been to Shake Shack in NYC and the hype didn't hit me until the Queen City got their very own!   On this visit we ordered 2 single patty ShackBurgers and a Cookie Butter Concrete. I was most excited about the concrete but once I tasted it it didn't really excite me. The concrete wasn't mixed that well and there was just one big glob of Cookie butter in the whole dish. (Note this is the opening day so you've got to allow for some hiccups). The star of the show tonight was the burgers and the fries!!!   Now our order was togo since it was close to closing and I had the kiddos. So you know we grubbed on fries on the car ride home. The fries were amazing. Perfectly seasoned, fresh and hot! They didn't need anything else added to them ie ketchup, extra salt or even my southern staple: ranch.   We didn't eat the burgers until we got home. My nephew got his custom burger order: Cheese, Pickle and Ketchup only. The ketchup is in a dispenser on the side and I had to grab a few to add to the burger once we got home. I got mine with Lettuce, Pickle and Shacksauce. The pickles are crisp and there was just enough Shacksauce.   Just a note they don't have a kids menu (smaller kid size portions) but they do offer things kids would like like grilled cheese and hot dogs. My nephew was able to demolish a single patty Shackburger!   Now to top off the experience they have the most amazing young lady named Consuela working the pick up line. She was very entertaining and kept everyone's spirits up. She made customers shimmy/shake for their food and had a very fun conversation with my nephew using the pagers.   I'm really happy to have Shake Shack in the Park Road Shopping Center. They are a great addition. I can't wait for the menu to grow and to see what treats they have planned for the summer!!!   Shake Shack  1605 East Woodlawn Rd Charlotte, NC 28209 Thursday April 26, 2018 9:30pm

aL5LKrwxIW_EYv1Cph8j6w.text: Nothing special. I ordered the shake shack burger and split an order of fries with my husband who got the smoked burger. I feel like five guys has a better burger and fries for way less money. Glad I tried it but not worth a return trip.

wWbgBkLd89eI0jH4gkTxCg.text: I love the milkshakes! The fries are crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Tasty!

xip3tFFUbXNYZTUowIRKCg.text: Burgers are so overrated it's not even funny. Many burger places in Charlotte 10 times better including one in the same shopping center. Fries are so so. People wait in line outside in boiling sun. The least they could do is have a canopy for people having to wait outside. Employees are nice but nothing like was mentioned in the 60 Minutes piece done in Oct 2017. I feel more welcomed at Chick Fil-A across the street. No real need to go back. Mooyah Burgers at Sycamore Commons has my vote for best "chain" burger and fries.

oni14iyYd-_hB_wyU5eLQA.text: Its one of my favorite burger places, i was so excited when they got this to Charlotte. I would have given 5 starts because they deserve it for the quality of the food and taste of the burger but, they need to understand that any customer doesn't like to wait in a line which takes him about 15-30 minutes to get to the cashier just to place an order. Thats one of the points that you need to take care about and it would be great if you can have couple more registers open during weekends in rish hours, and the time to get the burger is about 45 minutes which is actually making the fame and the craze for this brand to fall apart. Now coming to the burger its amazingly delicious i had the chick n shack and it was so good fresh meat not too soggy not too crispy it has the perfect texture of s burger and the fries were decent. I loved it and woul like to come back if you'll would try to reduce the wait time.
