UDewZcPnakv24xJ_IrGwKQ.text: Lunch on Tuesday- with all the options close by, parking close is crazy- opt for a few rows out and easy enough to get a spot without long walk. Grab menu before getting in line for efficiency. Moderate line, moved quickly. Staff is plentiful- mostly friendly & helpful. Son & I combined had their basic burger with bacon, cheeseburger, fries and shake. Both rated this a slightly better than average burger. Well cooked, juicy and crisp depending on thickness of Party- overall fairly thin. 11 year old says bacon 9/10, is overall burger 6/10. Cheeseburger was hot and gooey cheese, crisp onions & pickles. Found myself looking for "more" flavor. Overall 6/10 as well. Fries were hot, but "freezer fries". Milkshake (black & white) was thick & tasty. Glad we didn't wait long. .

Tl_KZEpC0ESCBRyVw0OCBA.text: Had the ckn sandwich , fries with cheese and the pumpkin pie concrete......hard to decide which was the best of the trio.  Fries were hot and fresh and cheese is light and addictive.  Chick sandwich was anA+ and the concrete with custard that is so so smooth mixed with pumpkin pie from none other than Suarez bakery.  Damn near perfect Saturday lunch .

SCO_jsszemxxmz2VgtdzNA.text: Boy, after all the hype before this came, I was disappointed in the food and the atmosphere. It's super noisy, for starters, with loud music blaring, kids screaming and loud conversation with little to dampen the sound. We took our food outside and that was better. But the burger was pretty tasteless. It's hard to screw up a milkshake, though. I enjoyed it, but we won't go back after trying it once. I can get a better milkshake at many places.

DBJaL379-5ggWFQOOK7DVw.text: Not waiting in line but what a great addition to charlotte. Took the family out and they are a solid burger spot. Don't sleep on the chicken sandwich, totally worth trying! Milkshakes are awesome as well

fyJiYUzyMEyPDWbb5nNl7Q.text: Very overhyped. Tried it twice and sure, it's good, but it's still just a burger. Slightly pricey for the quality as well - my milkshake alone cost more than my burger.

JCa3prpFGHB6cZUXAKEocw.text: Tiny portions and mediocre food. They are way too expensive for what you get. They charge about as much as Bad Daddy's but it's McDonald's quality. Also not happy with the fact that they don't have kids meals. Not into places where I have to pay $11 for my 4 year old to get a burger, fries and soda. The line was out the door and it was packed. But that's only because it's new and just opened. I don't see it staying that way, not with what they charge anyway.

7lbpgDO5TyTozCuXIZDdSA.text: Curiosity killed the cat and we checked out  the hype. While our Smoke Stack (patty, bacon, cheese, peppers and Shake Sauce) and Shroom Burger (Portobello mushroom as patty) were tasty, it was  pricey. The Shroom Burger costs more than the SmokeShack,  at $6.89 before taxes. Have a sweet tooth, so we had shakes and concretes too, which were again pricey for the size. Would we go again? YES. Would be foolish to wait in line for hours? NO.  Will try the app and compare the wait times-saw lots of patrons in and out pretty quickly who had taken advantage of that option.

4Ar2y_2ynFrbvMu_inbXkg.text: Despite being out of sweet tea, no biggie (I'm not a jerk like some of you are).  The food was banging!  Can't wait until my next cheat meal! Nice polite staff as well.  Two thumbs up.

ShgU_1UL_xLb-pMWmVyayw.text: Over priced average burger that on most days Wendy's beats hands down. Receipt time (visited today, Saturday, June 23rd) was 12:08, food arrived after a bit of confusion at 12:27. What, is the menu that complex? It's a burger joint! This place is a one and done. I can't see what the hype is all about unless the competition in NY was so lousy that people would gladly pay $5.29 for a $3.00 burger. My wife got their Shack-cago Dog, which JJ's on East runs circles around.  It was slightly better priced at $4.29. The French fries at $2.79 are over priced and rate as ok, crispy on the outside and mostly air inside - we termed them as air fries. The brand name may keep the people coming but the food won't be the reason to return.

SCEtcCeaJQNoEJAZO00e1g.text: Wow. The food and service here is fantastic. The burgers are always delicious, the fries are some of my favorite, and milkshakes are out of this world. My favorite server here Norry. He's very welcoming and provides great costumer service. 10/10.

2MXqvC97KkHG42hKNLSytA.text: Not healthy by any stretch of the imagination, but I do love how they are ingredient focused and source foods that leave out antibiotics, hormones, and pesticides. Thanks guys!

2XK1ySrt09qc5Ukk6o9iVw.text: 4th time here and it's still great. The double or single shackburger is always on point!!!

cTBJb-OmF__50TFiJPqmwg.text: Pleasantly surprised at the good quality of the burgers.  Service is great and helpful.  Will be back to try more things.

hUBjPR3awfj4MYJOrzKS0Q.text: Shake shack is soooo yummy! This location was extremely busy but they didn't let that interfere with the cleanliness or the great customer service. I'm not a fan of their BBQ sauce but everything else was really good. I had a burger and fries and my sister had a chicken sandwich and fries. We will definitely go again in the near future.

In9-UZtqu8QC1YE6Rt5LpQ.text: I was excited to finally try this place. I've heard much hype about it and yesterday, we finally took the plunge. The cashier was friendly and answered my newbie questions before ordering.  The wait for the food to come out seemed a bit long given it wasn't very busy, but I appreciate that I would get fresh hot food.  The burger tasted like a hybrid of Steak & Shake and Freddie's Frozen Custard & Steak-burgers. The burger  patties are thin with the charred edges similar to the other places I mentioned.  It was "Good." I'm not denying it was definitely tasty. The fries, I found remarkably unremarkable.  They are basic crinkle cuts that seemed like those I could make in the oven.  My real problem was the bill.  Now I will state that I spend a lot of money dining out and I don't mind running up a tab. If money is no object for you, go for it. For the cost of this meal I'd rather have someone bring it to me.  Our 2 burgers, before anything else were $20!  You might be saying well they must be real big burgers. They aren't. If you have any kind of appetite (and I do) you'll want something else. In summary Shake Shack has a tasty burger, unremarkable fries and a price that is a bit much for food I order at the counter.  I will give them a thumbs up for serving Coke Products.

L__MLcX6ENhcLWd2S3R7BQ.text: Not sure why anyone would rate this place poorly. It's a shake shake, i.e. a chain restaurant. The food is great and you know what you're getting. This location is also clean and the lines aren't anything like you would find in new york. Sounds like a good deal to me.

YzQFEwC4ULADTt1xdSxFqQ.text: Lived up to my expectations! I got the cheeseburger with lettuce, tomato, and pickle. My husband and I split the cheese fries. Both were delicious. Will definitely be back!

EiXjkb9c46yif0Bkl19JfA.text: Five stars so far because Michael Deen at the register was so helpful, pleasant and friendly for my first time here. Had a smile the whole transaction and was just the person I needed to come in contact with when entering a new business. I haven't tried the food yet, still waiting for my buzzer to go off, but I just HAD to talk about the customer service from Mike!!

Mw0aXHcejDrq5ldoBn-eTA.text: Took my wife and four kids here today for the first time. They do not offer any kids meals which is crazy. My 3 year old wanted a cheese burger and they wanted to sell me a adult cheese burger in which my daughter would've taken literally one bite out of and would've been a waste of $9.00. My wife order a grilled chicken sandwich and they said they were out of grilled chicken. The cashier was a smart ass as well so we decided to leave. Definitely won't come here again due to the lack  of it being kid friendly and rude staff.

itcChIvARBxzgmDN8-DVLQ.text: Went with the smoke shack and the cookie butter blender... my only complaint was that I ordered the small cookie butter rather than the large! DELICIOUS!!!

GZOPAveMu_z1bf-w8nkUUw.text: The burger was average and the fries weren't that great either.  Would have given three stars but relative to the hype, two stars seems more appropriate.

wZxg1Bjpmf9w_JNisxDHMQ.text: I was excited Shake Shack has expanded to Charlotte, but for the food itself, nothing special. I think the price is high compare to the potions and quality of food. They dong have a combo, you have to order fires and burger separately. I feel like shake shack is a solid 2 star for the food but additional star for the drink options!

Ruh79h8rS34r5C4bU5SUvA.text: I am a fan of Shake Shack in Atlanta! This was my first time at the Charlotte Shake Shack location. I had heard about the wait to order and the crazy line so expected nothing else. What I didn't expect was the ONE HOUR long wait after I ordered my food. I watched a few people demand a refund after waiting just 30 min. One customer even asked if they could open a third register and was rudely shut down. Multiple people who had ordered online and had a scheduled pick up were waiting even longer after arriving. Multiple staff members were taking breaks or messing around behind the counter and didn't seem concerned with all the people leaving or negative comments about the wait. I don't care how good the food is...it is not worth the hour+ long wait when we already have great spots like Soda Shoppe, Mr. K's and Brooks here in Charlotte!

4yyr5mQhgeSIxQegWxT7jw.text: One of my favorites! So glad Charlotte has one but please come to Greensboro or Winston!! Everything is amazing you can't go wrong

BJQfp-LyhvJePjVANBs1qQ.text: The chicken sandwich is awesome! I would even say it's way better than the burger. We also got a strawberry milkshake and the pie concrete ice cream and both were great.

jWrEQ2MXbjc0e8PxyBcsJw.text: It's ok.  Good burger. Ok fries. Price is pretty high for what you get. For two of us it cost $37 and that was two double burgers, one order of fries, two drinks and one frozen custard.

lmzE189DYyRT8xjhtWaFnA.text: People really waited outside for this place? I guess my expectations were a little too high. The burger was great... just as good as 5 Guys, but those crinkle cut fries are meh at best. But that's a personal preference.

2j3Z5gAvVXXgBw-yjiPzKA.text: Soooo good! Juicy delicious burgers with great simple toppings for a good price. The wait is a little crazy but the service is good.

T67AFYRhWyy_iI88e0PDMA.text: Monica was the best servers I ever had she need to be promoted and she always put smiles on people's faces. My order was wrong and she got it fix for me and fast.

W6LQGmFHyGopTuB-qJrqIg.text: My experience at Shake shack was very poor. I have been  multiple times but today was not one to make me come back. First of all, the prices are insane. I paid over 15 dollars for a "float", single burger, and cheese fries. The fries I ordered were very difficult to eat. They all broke up and it just become a pile of wet fries. Secondly, the float I ordered was not made. I went to go get my food and the women told me they ran out of vanilla custard. I was not that mad about that; however, she only offered to give me a new milkshake. Not a refund or anything like that. I ordered a chocolate milkshake and it was terrible. It was grainy and very milky. I did not enjoy it.  The people I was with also had their orders messed up. My friend ordered a milkshake and they made her pay for whip cream without asking. It was an extra 50 cents, and then when she got her milkshake there wasn't even any whipped cream! She obviously went and brought her shake asking for whipped cream, and the lady had the nerve to roll her eyes. Honestly I think this is very disrespectful and for the price you are paying, the customer service should be impeccable. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND!!!

cyJN4eSBp7mlwdiQOZdMjA.text: Food was horrible. I honestly have no idea what all the hype was about. Went there got an overpriced burger and soggy fries. Won't be going back. Wish there was an In N Out here!

Ulun2ukyz7daMuGMCFa4sw.text: Went a couple months back right at opening on a Sunday- there was a small line already. Didn't take long but I can imagine it would have had we arrived an hour later.  Food- burger was tasty, fries were fine, shake was tasty too. This is obviously a fast casual/fast food place SO I don't like their pricing, too expensive. However, quality is better than fast food joints. I'm a firm believer in burger meals being cheap as they take no skill and they're made up of cheap ingredients too.  They had just opened and their floor was sticky and slippery (like greasy) all at the same time- wth? I was nervous for their older customers- it was that bad.  Can't give them more stars b/c after all the hype it was just a notch above fast food and too expensive. Charlotte is always TOO hype for new food places.

BoCX2lWCseznvIh-Hctudg.text: Shake Shack lives up to the hype! I had a bacon cheeseburger and a vanilla shake, with shack fries.. Only downer, $18 bucks.. A bit over priced for a burger and fries.. After all this is CLT not NYC..

6TM-mAWZKxf0fwXEVBOMyA.text: The crowd was out the door. It took a while to get the food. It looked great. Taste of burgers and fries were not even as good or even ok. The smell should have been an indicator- fries had an after taste. Prices did not match. Too expensive. No topping offered.

Z_618LqpBFGrxtAC8B8CaA.text: Food was bland. Shakes were decent. Got my order wrong and had to wait longer. Came 40 min for below mediocre food. Back to Bad Daddy's I go.

Wzf1g_30zIhLUxF_OlDOTg.text: Yummm!   First time here and not disappointed.  Burger and fries are delicious. Staff is friendly.  We will for sure be back.

kYt7TqvQeGd7KLsKRPJkIw.text: Everyone has an opinion on this place.   Long wait times.  Pricey.  Burgers just OK.  I waited, too,  and paid nearly $25 for two burgers, regular fries, and a salted caramel milkshake (my wife and I split the meal).  The verdict?  Yepper, I'm a fan.  The combination of delicate (yet crispy) fries, juicy burgers on a potato bun, and that salted caramel milkshake might just be the best combo I've had in a long time.   Each on its own will probably find a better, less expensive victor.  But, not many places can put them all together well enough to warrant both the price and the demand.  Welcome to PRSC.  Nice to know I can walk to visit.  I say give 'em a whirl.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. My version of a happy meal (shared with my wife)
Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Double Shack cheeseburger with lettuce, tomato, pickles and onion.  Delicious.

coc8SgLwxUMPgQ-T2Q-sMw.text: I finally had the pleasure of enjoying a Shake Shack Burger! My husband and I waited in line for less than ten minutes. The service is quick. If you're indecisive the employees are patient and helpful. For many years I've been obsessed with In-N-Out Burger. Now, Shake Shack has made its way into my heart!  There are several signature sandwiches to choose from along with hot dogs and french fry options. I ordered the single-Shack Burger with a strawberry shake and fries. The burgers are more expensive than I initially thought they'd be. They're a decent size, the beef was seasoned well and had those nice crispy bits that you get with a good smashed burger, the potato bun is soft and delicious.   By the way, I didn't realize you could order beer and wine? I look forward to enjoying a glass or two during my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

Bv-X0PkjWWRHexj_JfoTPA.text: This was a nice treat. The burgers and cheese fries were exactly what my taste buds wanted. The burger was very tasty although once I was more than half way through I saw a little bit of pink....I'm not a pink girl. I like my meat brown all the way through. But it was still very tasty nevertheless. The cheese sauce on the fries was delish. Not to sharp not too mild. My hubby had a chicken dog with relish and mustard. He enjoyed it. And he also had a milkshake which of course he said was delish. I will get a shake next time. The price point was steep for a burger joint. 2 burgers, 1 regular fry, 1 cheese fry, lemonade and milkshake was just under $40. Was it worth it? Yes. I would say so. I plan to visit again in the future.

Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheeseburger with bacon

I-Mb0eJx_Pg0bI-m8n1Efg.text: I really wanted to like this place. My husband & I have been to this location on numerous occasions.   Our first visit was pretty good. The burgers were yummy & the service was quick. Our second visit ended up being the complete opposite! Our food was EXTREMELY greasy & it took FOREVER to get our food.   On both occasions, I ordered their shack burger with cheese, lettuce, tomato, & shack sauce. A single burger costs around $6 bucks & a double costs around $8. I decided to give the double a try on my second visit because I ended up leaving my first visit still hungry.... bad decision. The burger came out so greasy. It had soaked through the bun & you could see it on the lettuce. Not sure if the greasiness had to do with the double burger because I didn't have this issue with the single burger on my first visit.   Everything is overpriced in my opinion. The fries cost $2.79 & the milkshakes start around $6 bucks. They offer absolutely no meal options, so you have to order everything separate. My husband & I ended up paying close to $23 dollars WITHOUT drinks. Just seems high in my opinion.   The place does stay very busy! My husband & I usually have some trouble finding a table on the weekends. They do offer outdoor & indoor seating, which is nice. They also offer alcoholic beverages.   I do like the fact that they use 100% all natural angus beef. It has no hormones or antibiotics ever. I am a huge fan of eating food that is natural & better for your body.   Sadly, I'm not sure if I will be a repeat customer. My first experience was good, but my second was not up to par. I would save your money & just go to cookout. The food is cheaper & tastes better in my opinion!

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. They sell beer (cans &amp; draft) Woo!
Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Plenty of outdoor seating
Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

rRAhqvKtKVaztI19zzGsXQ.text: 5 stars maybe it's a bit unfair but these reviews are personal opinion right?  I'm a huge fane of Shake Shack and I wish they had one closer to me but, it's worth the drive.  There are burger places all of the city and while they all serve their own style of Burger and some have gourmet option some have no options, Shake Shack has enough options.  The fries are always Crispy, the burgers always fresh and like most places you can add bacon and anything. If you're lucky and not there on the weekend the lines aren't to bad though even when they are slammed they get all registers going and the line moves fairly quickly.   FYI they have seasonal items that you can find out about on their website, the bbq chicken Sammy is really good though at the time I'm writing this, you cannot get it (sorry), it's not the least expensive place you could opt to get a burger either, I still think it's worth it. I hope you enjoy it as much as I have!

7WvNpYTN4aFzme6zCKqASQ.text: With the opening of Shake Shack in Charlotte, everyone was up in a tizzy! So, not being a person who enjoys standing in line for hours for food I held off a few weeks before checking out the new location.  I stopped in several weeks after opening around 1:40ish, missing the lunch crowd. Luckily for me I only waited 10 minutes before ordering. Having never been I decided to try a few things, the Shake Shack Cheeseburger, added pickles, a classic Hot Dog and Fries. Overall I thought the burger and hot dog were okay, nothing outstanding....honestly I've had a better burgers elsewhere for cheaper. And, being a lover of Crinkle Fries, they were just plain blah! Not sure the issue but they weren't that fresh, I think they were sitting on the line waiting for the burger/Hot Dog to be ready, because they were cold and dry.  Overall, definitely glad I checked them out, their location is beautiful, but not sure this is where I would rush to when craving a burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shake Burger with Crinkle Fries

E_p_gxAZGlwUE_T4RbKa-w.text: Is it good? Yeah. Is it the second coming of christ as billed when Charlotte lost its damn mind over the opening? Nope.   In terms of the fast casual joints like this (Five Guys, Smashburger, etc), I have to say I think Shake Shack's burger is better. My go-to order is: a Shackburger (add pickles), cheese fries, and a small root beer. The root beer is Abita on draft. Pro tip: you don't need a large, free refills. Chicken sandwich is good, but for me I've got to get a burger when I come here.   There will always be a line. If you want to avoid the wait, download the app, order ahead, and skip the line.  I love that they are involved in the community. Local brews from Lenny Boy, Appalachian Mountain, and Catawba Brewing Company. They also donate 5% of sales of their Pie Oh My to support Loaves and Fishes, a local non-profit that provides food for families in crisis here in Mecklenburg County.  Plenty of outdoor seating. The front parking lot is tiny, drive past it and look for a spot on the back side of the store.

6B5CjueZ790AMMqRSwkmFw.text: I think that the hype over this place is crazy and I didn't meet up with the hype , but it was good.  Their burgers reminded me a lot of a Five Guys. The fries were good and these cheese sauce on the fries was delicious. Service was great. The place was clean and they have a nice little outdoor area. I wouldn't go out of my way to go back but would stop by if I was in that part of Charlotte. Quality burgers and fries. Got my food in about 10mins.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

w4injzcaQYxdXqO_T4AzuA.text: Finally made it out to the ever so popular chain to get our hands on some burgers. Waited a good bit because Charlotte truly lost their marbles about the opening of Shake Shack. Went midweek so there wasn't a crazy line or anything and the service staff was very friendly.   We went with the newly advertised burger with bbq sauce and bacon and it was great. Nothing wrong with the burger at all! We got the bacon and cheese fries for the side and they are a must! Definitely not healthy in anyway but I don't mind that at all.   I'd say that the overall prices are a bit high. Worth it to me for a good lunch while strolling through NYC but your money can for so much more here in Charlotte. But hey. Go ahead and stop in and see what the hype is all about. Specially if you can't make it up to their flagship stores in NYC.

L2VNVVWkHdYDaQ6rvo9HSw.text: OVERRATED is a Understatement...got the chx sandwich, with No seasoning with *herb mayo"which taste like bottled mayo & added herbs, w/ a side of again Nothing Special!!! Cheese fries were tasty ...my fiancee had, the double cheeseburger add bacon with "Shake Sauce"...ok..but nothing to write home about! On Any given day and half of a $34 and change bill, Zacks Hamburgers(Zack Special) or Chic-fil-a( still Undefeated Regular/Spicy Chx sandwich)...would have Well over Super Exceeded my expectations EASY!!! Dont Believe the hype!!!

2MZotNqaUcDDka7Ai-4UDA.text: When you want to eat all of the calories ever, this is one of the best places to do it.  The burgers are always perfectly grilled for me and my order has consistently been correct. One of my favorite things here is actually their Shack-cago Dog, though. I will say that while it's not technically authentic because there's no poppyseed bun, it is still enough to meet my craving because Matt's Chicago Dog is *never* fricking open when I'm near it and it's literally been years! Like, am I gonna have to take a day off work to get a hot dog?! I digress.  The fries are crinkly and very good when they're hot. I like them plain, with cheese or with chili and cheese.   The Shackmeister Ale is a decent pale ale, so I usually get that, but I do want to try one of those million calorie shakes. Maybe next time!   I'd definitely recommend this place if you want a good burger and fry meal. It's a contender!

SWMMMMuw22tjw8r_xEpIZw.text: Man, this was awesome! Had it first in New York and when I learned that they had one here in Charlotte I was so excited. You can't beat these delicious burgers, next time might have to go with the double cheese burgers. This place deserves all the hype!

Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

6oBz09ShYRHecpez120N3g.text: I got to go to Shake Shack before they opened as part of a Charlotte Agenda event and just recently went back again.   Both times I was there, the service was great. After being open for several months, the line is still consistently out the door. It does move pretty fast though. They are also pretty fast to prepare your food. Because it's still so crowded, it's hard to find a seat inside. There were plenty of tables outside in the sun, but it's not ideal in the Charlotte summer heat.   We got the double BBQ bacon burger, the BBQ bacon cheddar fries, the cherry pie concrete, and the cookie butter concrete. Last time, I got the double shack burger, cheddar bacon fries, and a double blueberry pie concrete.   I loved the BBQ featured items. The peppers on the Shack Burger were a little too spicy for me. The burgers are much higher quality than your typical fast food. The concretes are to die for.   As much as I love the food, I don't think it's worth the price. A double burger costs almost $10. It's definitely worth trying, but I can't justify coming back very often when it's that expensive for something that's still high quality fast food.

bvG9uSV0_mNXvVF4KQt3AA.text: I have had Shake Shack in NY and when I found out it was coming to Charlotte I was so happy. Little did I know I was better off going to Wendy's and saving a couple dollars too then eating here. Shake Shack is so overrated and not worth the time, money or energy to stand in line and wait for a mediocre burger. The fries I remembered in NY were so much better than the fries we got in Charlotte.   I was instantly over the hype and I am so glad I  didn't wait in a line so I could get darker and possibly sunburned. Yes brown people can get sunburned too.  I really want to order a bacon cheeseburger from Wendy's and order a Shake Shack burger and do a blind test with random people and see which one they think is better.   My guess is that Wendy's would win the challenge because we all know that if it was 5 guys in that taste test there would be no competition. Please save your money and skip this place completely and go to Wendy's for a better burger. I don't even want to tell you to go to Bang Bang Burger because you would just felt like you literally lit your money on fire by going to Shake Shack .   Even being this critical about their burgers I think the shakes and ice cream are the way to go as I'll give this place another try just to review the shakes and ice cream because the name is Shake Shack.  I'm glad they didn't name it Burger Shake because I would tell them their name needs to change. My thoughts on their burgers will not change

4cWq3r0gf1q8bNVFFoYq_Q.text: This is the only "Shake Shack" that I have ever gone to but I have heard wonderful things about it. We walked in and it resembled a "Burger-Fi". I ordered two chocolate milkshakes and a chocolate malt. We waited and waited and then we started to notice that the people behind us had already gotten their food. After waiting for about 20 to 25 minutes, our food was ready. I personally have tasted better chocolate shakes than this one but chocolate isn't my favorite flavor of milkshake. I would like to go back and try the burgers and fries just to see if it is really worth it. Overall I probably would not recommend this to a friend but I would recommend "Burger Fi" which looks the exact same on the inside and I really enjoy their milkshakes!

cQ5HubNfs8EjXFq3XrVjiA.text: Was just a little disappointed with my trip this time around. Just with the presentation of the food. Looked as if my chicken sandwich was just thrown together. For this  chicken sandwich to be almost a seven dollar sandwich by itself, I feel it should have been put together just a little better! Put some love in it people, I don't mind the price, but I want my sandwich to resemble a seven dollar sandwich! No matter how it looked the sandwich was really amazing!! The presentation is everything!

OUWuS9fHtxxfRnDg4fyWJg.text: Wow, I was skeptical at first I mean why would you stand in line for a burger and fries, but I did and it was delicious. hPSehNq-RlZ20246AQhVvA.text: I've been to the Shake Shack in Brooklyn a few times, and I don't know why I've been hyping it up so much. But after visiting this suburban location with my BF, I realized there really isn't much to it. I got a Shroom Burger which was good, and my BF got the Chik'n Burger. Although we got fries, he was still hungry off of one burger, and I felt really bad.   The "Blood Orange Ginger" Lemonade literally just tasted like regular lemonade with 90 pounds of sugar. pntZZ2Siq0ROM8XggGieCg.text: I enjoyed my burger.  It was fresh and juicy. I loved the fries. Counter service was not so good. I guess they have no tolerance for 1st timers. I want to try the chicken sandwich but I'm not sure if I'd chance it.

U8_8ckqRL0Rysow1EtuQ8A.text: The line was out the door and they only had one person taking orders when there are four order stations. uZ6k5Ewy6XN5rBXMzZlfqQ.text: Love the atmosphere here great lunch break even tho they get really busy but it's a really good lunch spot

RwRhQdJq3tbgRKeWat-BlQ.text: This is the casino of fast food.  You go in knowing the house is going to rip you off, but the novelty of this joint is what makes going at least once mandatory.  My wife and I went to an early movie and for the first time there was no line at around 9:30 on a Friday night.  I ordered a double shack burger and an order of fries, while the Misses had a single with a strawberry shake.  Total bill was $23 for four items.  The burger was tasty, but come on, $8 for a double burger ought to include the fries.  The wife's shake appeared to be about 12 fluid ounces.  For slightly less money, you can go around the corner and visit Smashburger which the food is about the same quality, or you could go over to Zack's Hamburgers and get a Zack Special for about half the price of The Shack.  As a matter of fact when we were watching the movie "American Animals" I told the wife that one scene looked like Zack's, and found out later that the movie was filmed in Charlotte and that was Zack's Hamburgers.  They don't make movies at bland establishments like Shake Shack, but they do at Zack's where you can go for the ambiance but stay for the food!

pdewRLtwRs3pGcu0ldxrDg.text: DON'T BELIEVE THE HYPE!  With that said by all means go try it and see for yourself this place is nothing more than a trendy overhyped overpriced waste of time.  I will say the Order via App option is solid and worked perfectly, food was ready promptly when promised and line was skipped accordingly.    Someone said that this is the new best burger in Charlotte that is laughable at best.  I would obviously rank it above any of your big fast food chains, McDonald's, Wendy's, Burger King etc etc it blows them away and it should.  It might be on par with 5 guys but for me falls below smash burger, hwy 55 and Culver's and wayback burgers which are your typical fast casual burger places and I feel offer a better product.  And I wouldn't even rank it with non chain places because it's not even in the same ball park.    I tried double shack burger, the fried chicken sandwich the cheese fries, cheese is on the side, and a orange creamsicle float.  First things first the burger, meat quality is good, it had a nice char on the meat, taste was slightly above average but I found it to be overly salty for my tastes.  Chicken sandwich was excellent but you will still find better at a Chick-fil-A, sauce they use on the chicken sandwich was very very good.  Fries were good, crinkle cut and crispy on the outside, slightly different crinkle cut than the super mass produced shape most places serve, cheese sauce was meh for me, glad it was on the side I didn't really like it, it's suppose to be a blend of American and cheddar I believe but overall just lacked flavor for me.  My orange creamsicle float consisted of them handing me a cup with a small amount of ice cream/custard in the bottom and pointing me at the drink machine to fill it with orange soda, the order was to go I'm assuming if you dined in they might construct it for you but I could be wrong.    There shakes which they are named after are $5+ which to me is laughable, now I don't mind spending money on food but to not offer any size option and have one price for a shake I think is kinda bad practice. My friend tried the shakes and said they weren't that good, they didn't even finish them and threw part of them out,  I will go back to try a shake just so I know for myself but I'm not expecting much.    I have to commend them on their hype/advertising you would think it's the best food in the world and it was free if you just look at how busy they are and how long the line usually around the outside of the building is.  But for me that's all it was is a trendy overhyped place, if you want a better burger there are many many options available to you, and if you want a good milkshake for a lower price then you also have plenty of local options.  When I'm craving a burger I will go out of my way for a good place, this is not one of those places for me.  I will not say I'm never eating there again but I doubt I'll be back very much in the future just not worth it to me.   I know food and I know burgers and this place is average at best, there are worse options and there are better options.  So go try it for yourself, form your on conclusion, and leave your own yelp review!

W0ncF90BiUpFDJlMkwWj7A.text: It's worth the wait if there is a line. I've always been a in n out supporter but when I first had shake shack I think i was swayed. It's delicious. The beef tastes great, slight crisp but still juicy. Fresh ingredients, CHEESE fries and they even have their own wine!

VH9oRjJg_-V2ykKfF4h73w.text: Can we just take a moment and appreciate the fact that CLT now have a shake shack- yesss. I've never had shake shack, and hearing all the hype I was super duper ecstatic to try it. Also since I don't eat red meat, I was happy to hear that they have a vegetarian burger option! When we arrive, there was literally no parking and the line was super long even after a week it had open AND the fact that this was a Tuesday. Notta problem because it moved fairly quickly. I ordered the mushroom burger, crinkle cut fries & shack sauce of coursee! The mushroom had cheese oozing out of it when you take a bite, yumm. I've never been a fan of crinkle cut fries but I gotta say it was pretty good! They were perfectly crispy. Shack sauce, hm it was alright nothing compared to in and out sauce (hehe)  also I recommend ordering the pie & icecream it was really yummy!

KECjwcGSAfBMdFnupNDW9A.text: The burger was very salty.  I don't understand why these restaurants feel the need to add so much salt to their dishes. Let the customer put salt on their food if they want.

-5Qc2230M8_Olotphs7BuA.text: Burger was subpar and the fries were cold, didn't expect this from a newer place!  I may try again.

dbchTFrMO6lMkwVLuWDU7A.text: Well, have finally made it to the Shake Shack! Got the Double BBQ Smoke Stack. Good Burger, But to me an average burger. got the Cheese fries and the Fifty-Fifty, there take on the Arnold Palmer, which was not bad. Which brings me to a 3 star. T0QLZmNDS_z8b65ZGDvkKQ.text: Best burgers I've ever had! I won't eat any other fast food burger ever again. Have had the double shack burger (two patties) with cheese and bacon a few times already...if the lines are long I don't complain because it is soooo worth it!

80M4G_aSyLp8OY7gqcq8og.text: It has a great vibe, kinda nostalgic. The burger and fries were good but the milkshake is the show steeler. We split two burgers and would diffidently go back.

PqudhUOMnDhaGWPkx5vZWA.text: A lot of people complain about the price, which is completely understandable but every tine I have been here the food has been great and the service has been quick, even with long lines. To me the burgers are much better than Five guys and the chicken sandwich is way better than a chick fil a sandwich. I find it weird that people would compare shake shack to a fast food place when it's more like fast casual..considering there is no drive thru. My girlfriend had been hyping it up for a long time, and since this location had recently opened up, I just had to see the hype.   It's a small burger with the price tag of a large burger. I ordered the Chik'n burger, and my gf ordered the Shroom Burger. We both enjoyed it, however, she was obviously full of one. I was still hungry. We ordered fries as well which were tasty especially with all of the sauces to dip it in. The "Blood Orange Ginger" Lemonade literally just tasted like regular lemonade with 90 pounds of sugar. Y257uvPKF9P-VQVqKRjyww.text: This was my first time eating at a shake shack, and the food lives up to the hype. First off, the employees are very friendly and they all greeted me and another couple when we walked through the door.     I got there a few minutes after the opened and ordered the Smokeshack burger and added lettuce, tomatoes and pickles with fries and a tea.  The burger was great, a kinda big that I couldn't finish all of it with the fries.     If you are in the area, I would definitely recommend stopping by, but you might want to go a little early because when I was leaving, parking lot was beginning to fill up.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smokeshack burger with lettuce, tomatoes and pickles

scQPRY9DKA8iw5ilDzOmbQ.text: I honestly don't understand the hype around this restaurant. We happened to be at the AMC and they had their lobby closed so were allowing outside food.   We saw Shake Shack and decided to try it. The menu is simple, burgers, chicken sandwich, chicken bites and shakes. I haven't had a burger in forever and decided to try one. Plus the menu is seriously lacking healthy options. Even fast food places offer salad and other options than fries as sides. Maybe I overlooked these on the menu. And everything is separate. No combo savings here. We ordered to go and it took about ten minutes to get our food. They were pretty busy.   So I ordered a single shackburger with fries and a drink. The burger was just okay and usually if I'm starving and haven't eaten bad in a while, it will taste like the best thing ever. This did not. Burger was flavorless and couldn't even taste the special sauce. Fries were just okay. They were crisp but nothing special.  Overall, it was overcrowded, overpriced with limited options. And then just okay food. I appreciate their environment friendly packaging, but my husband and I both don't really desire to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shackburger and fries

coNDQ11SwZyyqmHUrAj_cg.text: Solid three (and a half) stars. Every time I've visited I've been lucky enough to be at the Shack during off times so I've not had a long wait.  The food is overpriced but I go for the chicken sandwich. It's a great sandwich served hot and juicy! I prefer crinkle fries but shake shack's crinkle fries just don't make the grade for me. The one plus is that they're usually served hot but there's no seasoning.   I am a fan of their milkshakes, I'm not interested in their thicker concretes. The milkshakes are creamy and always hit the spot!

hT_uH2r5wcZDe2qCd9QZZQ.text: Shake Shack is in Charlotte... I guess that means we are a large city now?  It's great to see popular chains "break ground" in the QC because that means we have a large enough, and desirable enough market to be in.  I've had Shake Shack a couple times with my trips to Chicago so I already knew what to expect.  Unfortunately the Shake Shack in Chicago that I frequented wasn't the best, so I was cautiously optimistic about this location in Charlotte.  Being in Park Rd Shopping Center, it's a great location right off the bat.  I believe the Monkey Joes that used to occupy this space was demo'ed and a new, stand-alone building was built just for the Shack.  The parking lot/ traffic flow leaves a lot to be desired as there is a one-way road that loops back around the building, but it was definitely inconvenient that someone had blocked the drive to run in and get an online order or pick-up.  Either way, just be careful maneuvering around the parking lot.  I'll just chalk it up to it being "new" but I'll also mostly blame just people in general.  So I ended up parking in the "back side" of the building so I walked through the dining room to get to the registers.  The staff was super friendly and I knew the drill.  I still don't know if having the menu to where it is visible from the line is a great idea or a drawback cause there is no reference once you approach the register so there's a lot of swiveling heads.  Placed my order for a chicken shack, cheese fries, and a milkshake and was given a buzzer.  Everything is made-to-order but it's pretty quick.    The sandwich was solid and the crinkle cut fries were nice and crisp, the cheese on them were a bonus.  The black and white milkshake was delicious, but I had this feeling I had to workout the next two days to undo my intake from this meal.  Overall it was a solid experience.  It was a weeknight and there was a steady flow of people.  I can't imagine that the line is like on the weekends... oh, but I have definitely driven by and seen the line, literally out the door.

QKmyA40o-PGGrfALtEmSjQ.text: This is a casual, upper level fast food joint like Five Guys and Chick-fil-A. It's a good place for a middle of the road burger, fries and shake. The location is right in Montford and has plenty of parking in the park road shopping center.   One of the reasons I gave it three stars is because for basically a fast food joint, it's not very fast lol. I'm not sure how long it takes to cook a burger and warm up some fries, but it seems to take forever to get your food. There's lots of indoor and outdoor seating, so if the place is packed, you're gunna be waiting.   The hubs swears by their milkshakes. Like, really loves them. So if you like shakes, try them out. Patio seating is nice and also dog friendly, bonus! It doesn't do it for me, but try it out and make your own opinion!

SXkOUlTR6PkwAoLaFhagnA.text: Update: I have been here several times now and so I thought an update would be good. I still like it here. I like the cheeseburgers the best. I usually order a cheeseburger with lettuce, onion, and pickles. I get the shack sauce on the side. I love them. They really make a great burger.   I don't care much for the hot dogs, just my preference. I also don't like the milkshakes that much either. Here's why: they are really pricey, they are extremely thick, and the flavor (chocolate in particular) wasn't doing it for me. This is only my opinion, because I know plenty of people who love them. The fries are just ok, while I love crinkle fries, I think the ones at Shake Shack are coated with something a little different. I do eat some it they are at the table, I don't hate them, they are just not my favorite.  The waits are killer. I downloaded the app to avoid them, because they just take to long to get through. I recommend 100% getting the app. The service is hit or miss. Sometimes the staff is really nice and sometimes really frustrated or possibly annoyed.   All in all, I like this place. I will be back continuously for the cheeseburgers. I may even try the hot chicken or grilled cheese. Stay tuned for future updates.

BqzZRxx6ZnFlAOGBJrSySw.text: I finally had enough time to come in and see what the hype was about. It kind of feels like a chipotle when you're in their dining area only with real lighting and more chairs.   I had the Shack Burger and fries. They have the crinkled kind of fries that I really don't care for normally, but they weren't too bad. They were nice and golden without being overdone or soggy. My Shack burger I customized slightly with pickles and a little mustard. They let me add the pickles for no charge, yay. The burger was a good solid burger but not quite on my top 10. There just wasn't anything outstanding or impressive about it.  Shake Shack was great to try while I was in the area, though I might not go out of my way for it. I'll stop in again eventually to try a milkshake if I'm in the area.

The burgers are freshly grilled and the toppings are always fresh.  Fries. I'm not a crinkle fry person by a long shot but these fries (with cheese) are just always cooked to a golden perfection.   I highly recommend Shake Shack and will try my best to go in any city. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Double Shack burger w/cheese &amp; cheese fries

csOiIxAr2Dvuc1Ewe2oLig.text: Shake Shack's burgers are amazing. They're normally cooked medium but they will cook then to whatever temperature you want. It's all made to order too and the flavor definitely tells. If you have any dietary restrictions they'll work to get you something you can eat. And what burger goes without fries? Their fries are fresh and taste even better with their melty cheese sauce. They've also got milkshake and concretes made with custard rather than ice cream so if dairy doesn't agree with you, you'll love these. There's almost always a long line so don't come if you're in a super big rush but you are able to order online to skip the line. Just be aware of what time it is when you plan to go there.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shack Stack with bacon and cheese fries

gldxV9dXfJB3wZUz5b1u7g.text: Yes, it was pricey but everything I inhaled was good. The burger, fries, and shake were all great. Had the shroom deal but I wish I had ordered my wife's shroom burger - big difference. I'd also ask for more of the shacksauce on my burger if I could do it over. Looking forward to giving this one another go...

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best crunchy fries ever

5K9Lb_YrW504b7GtKioLHA.text: For a fast casual burger, they've got good flavor (their special sauce) and crispy patties. Service is fairly quick and the inside is clean.  I recommend the classic Shackburger, which has their special Shack sauce. If you want all the toppings, just ask, otherwise it comes classic with tomatoes and lettuce. Definitely get a side of crinkle fries, which are super crispy on the outside and soft on the inside -- as they should be. If you want to do it right, getting a shake for your fries is a good move.   Their Pie Oh My dessert uses local Suarez bakery pie. They also support local with their drink options.   The line is usually long, but it's gotten smaller now that it's not the new hotspot around town anymore. In general, it's always best to go before 12 or after 12 but not directly at noon if you want to avoid the biggest crowd of the day.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

du4uFiqwRmWWsqiOTFOr2Q.text: I really really wanted this to be so amazing. Still giving it 4 stars because my first time trying this I was extremely hungover. I feel like if my stomach didn't hurt so much in the first place I would of enjoyed this more.   This place was so crowded-- like I'd expected, Charlotte NC being as stressful as it is, we could not find parking for like 20 minutes, but stuck with it because I really wanted to try shake shack but didn't think I'd be going to NYC anytime soon. I ordered the most basic entree I think. The shack burger and fries. Comes with cheese, tomato and lettuce. It was fine. I guess their wow factor that I did not love at the time was the the burger patty it's self was like smashed and it was kind of crispy.. I guess I just like a thick juicy burger.. I also feel like they were supposed to have some secret sauce, my burger was loaded with mayo, which did not make my stomach feel too great.    I liked the fries though.. they were super crispy and crinkle cut. I'd definetly try it again, and I hope next time I have a different experience.

z55zQvAMOvbRHKhzul_pRA.text: My treatment this evening superceded the food. I ordered my food. 2 orders to go of the same thing. I recieved the 1st order and I continued to wait for the 2nd order. The guy sternly asks "may I help you?" I told him I didn't get all of my food. The cashier came over and told him I had 2 of the same orders. I observed him being short with his coworkers. When my food came up he put it on a tray for in house dining. I told him it was to go. He ignored me. I repeated myself and he says "I know!" He then starts moving super slow and puts my drink back. I told him that's my drink. I'm upset now. I told him "c'mon now, no need to act like that towards me." He said "you have an attitude" I told him no I don't. He told me to "chill out." I said "I am a grown up and you dont speak to me in that way!" I couldnt ask for a manager because everyone disappeared until I left. My daughter was waiting for me in her car. I told her what happened and she went back inside to tell a manager what happened. He informed her that the young man was about to be pulled off the line to be spoken to about the situation. Hopefully someone will contact me from the message I left.

L2Ej3xyCWd-P_KiPWH-rnA.text: The food here is good, but the service is an absolute hot mess. I have never gotten takeout from here and it be A. On time B. Correct C. Efficient.   They always take 5-10 minutes over the order time and can't seem to understand basic instructions like "put the sauce on the side". The food is absolutely not worth the slow, confused service (slow and confused even for a fast food joint)

X8Y0ae5cDyjUhxELTm46_w.text: I was very underwhelmed by my food, the service, and overall experience at Shake Shack.   We arrived at 11 am on a Sunday morning and the place was hopping. We ordered burgers, fries, and unsweet tea. They don't give you a cup for the tea, like they do for soft drinks, they give it to you when your food is ready. We order and wait 20 minutes for our pager to finally buzz. 20 minutes without a drink was quite disappointing.   Then we wait at the counter another 5 minutes for them to hand us the food. The "side" of sauce I was given was truly laughable (see picture). It was enough for 2 fry dips. I returned to the counter to request more sauce and a drink refill a bit later and of course it was much more waiting and I eventually just gave up.   Food was ok but nothing special. Burgers are really thin. Can't get refills on tea without a long wait, and they don't have sweets-n-low. The place was a cluster of confusion, did not have enough employees, and I won't be back.

Jn_a4Ou7zrZhcdJDpv36zA.text: As a first time foodie, at this location I did feel overwhelmed by the menu. There's so many options to choose from. And you don't want to feel that your first experience of going to be the worst because you made the mistake of choosing the wrong thing.  But ultimately I decided to be very simple, I chose the shake shack burger and I added bacon. And I also chose their deluxe fries. And that was no mistake at all, when I say I was in food heaven. I would swear that God was one of the cooks myself. It was so delicious, not in a wagyu kind away but in the way that everything melted in my mouth. And please keep in mind I have braces so that is is extremely important. The fries were so delicious. I was suggest that you paraben with any beer they have on their selection, preferably an IPA.

1Ps6YbaeV5g2vzyvSc4NeQ.text: I absolutely love shake shack! This is the closest one to me (2 hours away) so whenever i'm in town I love to stop by! The customer service is prompt and they are very polite. I always order the smokeshack burger and it's delicious!

9UifeoG6Ala9eloWUUfEyw.text: Shack Shake got it right again in NC! I've been to several of the locations across the US and this newly opened restaurant only had one issue.. too many people wanting to get in. No need to worry though, once the hype dies down a little (or they open another in Charlotte), that problem will be solved. On this visit I tried my first shroom burger and chicken sandwich, both held up to the beefy standards set forth by other Shack offerings. Go to here, try it, leave with a full belly!

Fx-5Zvj9cJ_R86F7fuX9rQ.text: -Amazing chicken sandwich!!! -Order on the app -Chicago dog, meh -shake, different consistency than most (not my favorite)  I will definitely be back for the chicken!!! But will order on the app next time

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

4JSPBuXgmXVJXmTI6E3Xpg.text: We wanted to see what all of the buzz was about. The food was great. There is a long wait. A really long wait. You will get pumped faked when your buzzer goes off. It doesn't mean your food is ready. It means...well I'm not sure how to calculate what it means or when it will be ready. It means it's coming close to being ready. I did have some enjoyable conversation with others who also thought their order was ready. I think the volume of customers and the demand on the kitchen makes it difficult for them to keep up. I will admit that the food was worth the wait.  I had the double smoke burger. It was very tasty. I also had the shackstack concrete. I enjoyed it thoroughly. My wife had the single cheeseburger and a  vanilla milkshake. She received a chocolate milk shake and she didn't like the taste of it. When she finally got her vanilla milk shake, she loved it.   I recommend everyone to try it. I will come back and try the chicken.

5-rSgKtVqJBLgDV2DTPBxg.text: Do you want a delicious burger? Do you want a milkshake? DOES YOUR DOG WANT ICE CREAM? Do you like crispy fries +/- cheese? Do you like friendly service?   It is what it is, it's very good at what it does, believe the hype, don't listen to the haters, and treat yoself.

lk_-YMsHkglIeDkSQ83_FQ.text: Some days you want shake shack some days you want five guys and there's nothing wrong with that. Great add on to the burger scene in Charlotte. Consistent with the up north original this place offers up a great burger the pepper relish is amazing over all highly recommend now that the wait time has become normal

6kARsFLgsWkQ9PXf-zJR_A.text: Out of cheese....that is completely unacceptable for a burger place. Drove 20 minutes away for disappointment.

4dxMhDWx3CWGPcdzJIaBhg.text: I'm so glad Charlotte has Shake Shack. This is my favorite. I love their delicious shack burgers, tasty fries, and yummy shakes. Highly recommend!

3oBei7z_mY2F6MOiWBpF5g.text: The best part about dining at Shake Shack were the employees. They were so kind and attentive. Apart from the service the food was delicious as well. There are so many different options. The BBQ cheese fries are to die for!!! The wait wasn't too bad either. Overall, it was a great experience!!

z3SUrkbYB9WOp9Id09QMRg.text: OK, we've seen the lines, heard the hype and watch the stock take on Amazon characteristics. I had not been but wanted to see what all the hype was about. Milkshake products, very nice. Alcohol, nice but really burgers go better with Coke or a shake than a smooth cab. The atmosphere was pleasant but not over the top. The burger.... the fries has anyone heard of Five Guys? I mean we aren't even talking comparison. Shack's fries are like the kind you heat up in the oven from the frozen food section of the grocery, the kind with the ridges that taste like freezer burn. We ate maybe half. As for the Burger.... I was with a friend at The Smith in New York two weeks ago. He had a burger. Halfway through the juice from the burger has disintegrated the bun on the bottom. I remarked that was a sign of a good burger. Shack's bun was intact all the way through. The meat was crunch rather than juicy. The add ons were undistinguishable. Bad, no, really boring, absolutely. Would I go back, sure if someone in a group insisted. Otherwise, head to Five Guys. If you need alcohol, do takeout. All hype. I've now had Shake Shack and Five Guys is still the best burger I have ever had.

_UVfI1ZniYWQPXOIhqiQ5Q.text: Food is always fresh. Friendly staff and very efficient food line in ensuring food comes out fast and hot.

-zHMMjOzeJR8zePKfxIl8A.text: I got this icy cold Burger from Shake Shack. What a disappointment. $11 down the drain. I'm at Smash Burger washing the taste out of my mouth with a Pub Triple Double for $3.

3maBb4GM-79301XJuXCllQ.text: Definitely above average. Burgers are cooked to order and come out with good presentation and taste. I had both the SmokeShack and the ChickenShack and both were pretty good to me. Shakes are handmade upon ordering and look good though I didn't get to try

gHM-iFO2oZ_rOm7AN0lTHA.text: Okay to began with the staff was really kind and welcoming. But look I'm not tryna be petty but that meat is way to salty. This place is mad expensive for what they give you that Burger is legit a disgrace it is so small I could go down the street McDonald's and get a bigger one for cheaper.

loSQpyrGb-yetSZthLb4sw.text: I waited a little while (about three months) before going in as everytime I drove past, I saw huge lines. Parking is convenient due to the location so that's a definite plus. As far as the food itself, while good I thought it would be a bit better. The burgers and fries were indeed tasty but at the price point offered I thought they would be bigger and have a better flavor. While a burger shop like this is a great addition to the Woodlawn area for those looking to avoid the bar scene with it's dingier aspects, there are a lot of places to get a better burger not too far outside of the neighborhood. I would try it at least once, see what you think, but you might be put off by what you get for the price.

qVI8AP5g27GM5ajF__rbLA.text: I give it a 4 because the chicken sandwich was bomb but my boyfriend got the cheeseburger and it was so small that it looked like two pieces of bread..when asked for extra sauce we literally received a quarter size amount. Slightly overrated and expensive for what you get.

jPXdgWzQtNVLwu8s3XBGsQ.text: Tried this twice on two different trips out west. Both times I was not impressed. Decent burgers, crinkle cut fries, and pricey. Friys hot and crisp. This place is big, clean, and we'll staffed with friendly folks. Hope it stays that way. Lots of outdoor seating also. I'm not as thrilled with the chocolate shake. RwbzoEApe8AcH80TAQVVSQ.text: I came in with a friend for lunch. It was very busy. Ordered a Shack burger and a Mushroom burger and fries.  Overall I would say it was just OK nothing special in my opinion.  If you are after a really good burger try Fenwick's on Providence Road.   10/11/2018 This is my second visit. Because of my first review I wrote Shake Shack comped me a burger and fries.   Now that things have settled down I would say things have improved. This time I ordered a cheeseburger and fries. I put mustard on the CB. The cheeseburger looks small but that's deceptive. The burger is rich and very filling. Fries were hot and crispy. If they learned how to make onion rings like South 21 on Independence Blvd. They would have a real hit. Shake Shack, check out South 21. And try a burger at Finwick's. You will be happy you did.

6TdieQHcJyefCtC2sbqfxg.text: Over rated. It takes 15 minutes to wait in line and 20 minutes after that to get your food. If you order online, it's still 15 after the time that you selected and were notified that your order is "ready". I dont get why everyone is so wild for this place. Buns are great and shakes are good, but it's not close to being worth the wait, the hassle or the cost.   Staff could not be any more ambivalent about your experience. Save $30 and make these burgers at home

yWG_WPYwXZ1EdI1U2Uuvxg.text: So, never had a burger from shake shack...heard all the buzz about their burger and how delicious it is.  I've heard this before about another burger joint out in the wild west and I went in and out of that place.  Their burger was okay and maybe too much hype about their burgers made with sauce from animals or something.   ;-) I was pretty disappointed in that other experience and didn't think it was that "awesome."    So back to Shake Shack...I was expecting a similar situation with hype over heat.  I ordered a Shack burger, double pattie all the way (the way it has it on the menu).  Also ordered crinkle cut fries (normal) and a desert "Oh my pie" (custard with blueberry pie), which we put on hold until we finished our food.  So the burger...the patties are pretty thin patties (not a thick fat juicy burger) so I'm glad I got the double.  But even though they are thin, they were pretty MOIST, which was a plus (a bit greasy, but not sure what you'd expect from burger). It was good!!  Overall, I was happy with my burger.    The crinkle cut fries were hot, fresh and pretty crunchy.  Kudos for not giving me greasy fries.  The wife enjoyed the fries...and she loves her fries.    Now, for desert.  We are a fan of A custard place that is Good and they have berries.  Shake shack isn't as good as that place (to be fair, Shake shack is known for their burgers and that other place is known for their custards), but still was pretty good.    So overall, very pleased with the food and the service.  I would definitely recommend this place and would revisit in the future.  If you are looking for a decent burger place, give this place a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

111LBJyWhE0Uvmz_8ejUIA.text: I first saw Shake Shack months ago in NY and I was determined to try it however the line was wrapped around the building,  Fast Forward to last Sunday I was looking for a quick dinner and there's Shake Shack.  I was truly disappointed.  The burger was mediocre at best, the fries were cold, and the young lady at the register and beverage station was totally confused.  At the register we were told our drinks would be prepared with or meal, we received the meal...no drinks.  I had to explain what we'd ordered all over just for the young lady to start talking to someone else when I was mid-statement.  Then she comes back to me and greets me like I wasn't just talking. One of my beverages was a "fifty-fifty" which was described as a tea/lemonade mix. The young lady asks, what did you want in your 50/50? Ummmm...exactly as it's described on the menu.  Next stop, condiments station...which we had to squeeze between 2 of the staff.  It appeared the were on break which the chose to enjoy in the middle of the walkway, while looking at the customers as if they were bothering them for trying to squeeze through for beverages, bathroom and drinks.  The final verdict...I will not revisit Shake Shake. Specially not this location...

cenWVZc9_nhnuiX27_suAg.text: Excellent food! The burgers are prepared just perfectly and literally for once look like the advertisement! The lettuce really does look the way it does in the picture! Lol!The only reason I didn't give it a 5 star is because of the price. $27 for 2 burgers, 1 fry and 2 drinks. There is no way a large family could afford it. Still a nice splurge every now and then.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

Sh8pOZ4S779DVQ6LFlauOg.text: It's been 6 years since I was at shake shack last in DC. Went to shake shack the other day and it was completely different from what I remember. Line may be long but they move you through extremely quickly. We ordered cheese fries, double shack burger, and the pie oh my concretes (pumpkin pie) burger was extremely good and so was everything else. Ended up leaving In a food coma. This is a fast casual place. Dont come in expecting a sit down restuarant style burger. It is in line with five guys, except better In my opinion.

M2peeocs9Dmov1GZAUhVrQ.text: They make a pretty solid burger. I have a gluten allergy and I was really happy with the GF bun, and they served my burger separate from the rest of our order-which I really appreciated. Couldn't eat much of anything else. The girl taking our order was pretty rude, barely spoke and was texting the whole time. Other employees were friendly and helpful, so it was still a good experience. My husband loved the shake.

6kdyyRc5LY3xqD_O93t1Ug.text: Finally tried out shake shack. Glad I didn't wait in line for it. It was good but not crazy good. The burgers taste exactly like smash burger to me. They're small too. The cheese fries were great but very heavy and I can kill some cook out cheese fries... trust me when I say they will make you feel bad...but they're good!! I didn't feel like spending another $5+ on a milkshake after spending $24 for two small meals. But next time I'd come back for that and the fries.

hCu5n9iHYZqlXcWuBpxGvg.text: Exceeded all my expectations! I'd been told it was good, but it really wasn't; it was great! The burger was very flavorful, the bun was soft, the fries were crunchy & crispy, while moist and filled with potato flavor, without being over-cooked! Really good crispy, but not overdone fries like this are not easy to make! To finish off the meal I got a (small!) shake, and it was fantastic too! And if atmosphere means anything to you, you'll find it's great too! Absolutely not what I was expecting from "fast food" at all. In fact, it feels like a disservice to call them a "fast food" place; they're leagues apart and above the places most of us think of as fast food!  As far as I could tell, everything was made from fresh, basic, simple, REAL food. Nothing tasted artificial...it just tasted great!  It's probably not a place to go if you're looking to cut calories, but I fully admit, I went in as a 1st time visitor planning on a cheeseburger, fries, and a shake, so I didn't even notice if they had salads or other lower calorie options. I'm confident that if they do, they're made from the same kind of fresh and tasty ingredients.   Just typing this review makes my mouth water!

Hp8SFkVltvHtbwDiwS2lvQ.text: I'm not crazy about the prices, but that is one quality burger! This is my second visit and they didn't leave me disappointed yet again. This time I got a milkshake with my meal and it's small, but very delicious. I would definitely split a burger with my boyfriend to cut the cost of spending $30 at a "fast food" place however.

KzNKLTie4MufAhBfClyAWA.text: Juicy and perfect! Oh my goodness. The line went quick and my order was ready in the usual time. I got exactly how I asked my order to be, nothing was missing and I was beyond happy. The dinning area was clean and there were plenty of tables readily available. I drove a long way to come visit so I was very happy with my experience. Thank you everyone at Shake Shack, keep up the good work. See y'all soon!

JoAN_SfGQuIBnPJBNL47Xg.text: I finally made my way over to the much hyped Shake Shack. Park Rd shopping center is known for wonderful food delicacies. While this makes a nice addition to the area, I wasn't as wowed as I had expected! I had the Smoke Shack. The burger had chopped cherry peppers, applewood smoked bacon, and a spicy mayo. The burger was cooked perfectly and the bun was so soft. The crinkle fries were fried to a golden crisp perfection. I enjoyed my meal but didn't feel that this would become my preferred burger go to. I doubt I will come here unless a friend invites me too. I have heard good things about the shakes and chicken sandwich, so I would be willing to give those a try.

h2Xg9MkSrSu4mtvnBVPgEA.text: The eagerly anticipated Shake is finally here! I had to go see what all the fuss is about. The food: it was pretty good! I appreciate  the simplicity  of the burgers and that they use Yellow American cheese. I definitely reccomend the chicken sandwhich. It was awesome. Fries are nice, crisp and they hold the cheese sauce well. So food wise, Shake Shack is a-ok! The reason for 3 starts is because there is usually a line out the door. But.... the times ive been its not because they are that busy. Its been due to the cashiers (only 2)showing no sence of urgency. Also, it would be nice of the staff to wipe down the outside  tables after it rains so the customers can sit outside without getting their clothes wet.

fqQnmv2qn-8OPSzet8Q1Yg.text: Two-stars feels like a knee jerk reaction of what I interpreted as an average burger that was preceded by unreasonable hype, but when I see how yelp defines 2 stars, "Meh.  I've experienced better." I think that accurately describes the experience.  Food - 2.5/5 - If anyone has ever seen that burger king whopper jr. bullying video, I can say that my shack burger looked like it was bullied in the back kitchen.  The bun was flattened and didn't really fill out the wrapper it was put in.  The patty was decently seasoned and enjoyable.  However, when comparing to similar quality burgers, it did not stand out.  Value - 2/5 - These things are damn expensive.  Family of 4 in front of me walked away with a $60 tab.    TL;DR - If someone asked me if I wanted to go to shake shack with them I'd say "Fine".  If someone asked "Hey, where should I go grab a burger?  I would not say Shake Shack.

4SflGPRGQLCwclBs_YJUSw.text: It's as good in the south as it is in the "north". My first time at Shake Shack was years ago in DC. I enjoyed it then and I enjoyed it today. I got the Shack burger with the shack sauce on the side, fried and a drink. The burger was delicious and it's well seasoned for a fast food burger. They cook them as they're ordered, so they're not sitting under one of those heat lamps. My burger still had some pink in the middle, which I didnt mind bc I like my burgers medium. I'm not a fan of crinkle cut fries, but the fries at Shake Shack are pretty good. They're crispy, which I like because often times, crinkle cut fries can be soggy, especially if they're cooked from frozen. I must have picked the sweet spot time and day because there was no line. I walked in and ordered my food, the cashier said it would be 7-10 mins and it was less wait time than that. Shake Shack does have vegetarian offer, they have a mushroom steak burger. They also have chiken sandwiches and hot dogs. It's a fast casual place but if they got a drive thru location, that would be bomb. They have high top community style tables as well as low top tables and booths. They also have outdoor seating. I'll be back when I want a quick burger as long as there's no ridiculous line outside.  Update: so I'm not really ashamed to say this, but I came back two days later. This time I got the bbq and smoked cheddar bacon burger. Their bbq sauce is pretty good on the burger. It's not too sweet and it's a bit tangy.

iBM_BpKjAvXM2jPEAXBAKA.text: Not much to say... it's shake shack.  Good, on the go food.  Atmosphere is... better than McDonald's and much cleaner than other chain fast food places Staff is pleasant.  I would recommend to others for lunch.

ijbgC70aqbVmutZcUVkNtQ.text: Great burgers & Chicken! Always very clean and friendly staff! Cant go wrong with their shakes either :)

fK45-TAmPyTbLQYrboGKCA.text: Shake shack just (well, kind of...) opened up in Charlotte and I had to try it! I'm a fan of the original locations in NYC, so I wanted to see how Charlotte stacked up. In short: Charlotte Shake Shack makes a great burger (especially compared to the burger competition nearby), but it can't beat other Shake Shack locations.  I got a burger and their signature fries. The burger was okay: the patty was a little dry, but it was hot and everything worked well together. The brioche-style bun was great, too. The real star here was the fries, though. They're crinkle fries just the way I like them- crispy on the outside and softer in the middle! With some extra crispy ones throughout, of course.   The vibe in Shake Shack is great. I think families could definitely come here (lots of booths!), and it would be perfect for watching a game too- lots of big TVs. Overall, SS was so close to being a new staple in my book, but I think I'll be hesitant coming back (though those fries were delicious).

a5kAXaZY1Jhp_nHyYz5uAA.text: Shake shack... is shake shack. I've been to Shake Shack before in DC and knowing that it opened in Charlotte I wanted to check the place out. And well, it was exactly what I expected, minus the amount of people that was lined up outside the restaurant about an hour before closed.   I ordered some smoke shack burgers, however I did ask for a lettuce wrap which I can confidently say that Shake Shack does do. The only problem with their lettuce wrap burger is that it's not the greatest. Granted they are known for their potato buns but, for me I am always trying to find ways to cut down the carbs if it's possible. We had a huge order, and let's just say they're not that great at that, so my experience was a little different than others.  This Shake Shack needs to still fix logistics problems and get faster with getting their orders out. So, I don't think it's perfect and there is still definitely work that still has to be done.  Price wise... I think it's a little high for the burgers. They aren't the most amazing burgers, and I sort of still think for fast food burgers (on the East Coast) for lettuce wrap burgers for me... Five Guys still holds supreme. But if it's on the West Coast, In-n-Out all day. And you will definitely be asked which is better if you've been to both. People in Charlotte now have the chance to weigh in on their opinions.   Overall, Shake Shack isn't bad. It's actually pretty awesome. I think that this location needs to speed up their orders, but it's understandable that they have a line and it's pretty hyped. And also, it's nice to see it get to Charlotte. Definitely recommend you to try it out if you haven't gotten the chance to. Just know that you will probably encounter a line.

Y5GdBrggOuz7R6lb_DKwgQ.text: So I've had shake shack before in Vegas and really enjoyed it (thought it was better than in-n-out)!   My family and I ordered an array of burgers, fries, and milkshakes. I don't remember the prices being as high as they were in Vegas but we spent about $50 on 2 double burgers, 2 chicken sandwiches, 2 cheese fries, a drink and a milkshake which is insane...  But all in all I still enjoyed the burgers they were made to order with fresh ingredients, loved the crinkle cut fries, not a huge fan of the chicken sandwich but at least we tried a variety of items on the menu to know what is good. I'm sure we will be back.

dkDwyLPagnky9X63yBrM9g.text: Ordered a burger, a side of fries, and what seems to be a 12oz milkshake($5+) for a total of $18. I'm not saying that this place is not good, it actually is really good and I highly recommend coming here. The burgers are way better than Five Guys and the fries are delicious. Prices is pretty similar to Five Guys, but the food is way better. Definitely will be coming back!!!

ojB3PhrKvR94XEJKEH6xlA.text: Didn't care for it the first time I went but ever since I got the mobile app, I'm obsesssssed.  The burgers are so good and hot and melty and the bun is so soft!   I love their seasonal shakes - the Christmas cookie one was to die for. And their fries are always crispy.

kyLeLJ8xZgop16Ll2Iqzlw.text: Call it hype if you want but if anyone finds anything wrong with these burgers, your taste buds are either in need of a tune up or you just don't know what a good burger is. That's my story and I'm sticking to it.  I came here on opening day in hopes of being one of the first 100 in line to get a free hat but after lollygagging at home, I didn't get there until 10:30 and by then the line was wrapped around the building.  Despite the fact that we knew we wouldn't get a hat we wanted to eat because we knew what was in store for us. I've been to the NY and DC locations and when I found out that Charlotte would get the first Shake Shack in NC, I was ecstatic.  We met some really awesome people in line and ended up eating with them, being on NBC News Charlotte's facebook live broadcast and live tv broadcast.  How fun! Got my 15 minutes of fame. Ha! Well after an hour and a half we made it into the doors and considering there were probably almost 200 people in line before us, it wasn't bad.  They had so many people working and they were ready! We (had my teenagers with me) ordered three single shack burgers and added onions on it for no extra charge, some fries and soft drinks with some Shack Sauce on the side. We sat outside on the spacious patio and despite how busy they were, there was still plenty of seating. We took pics and then dug in!  What can I say? Worth. The. Wait.  Now, I'm not a big crinkle cut fry fan but since I've had them before, I knew what I was getting.  Everyone at our table loved their food and the manager even brought out a blueberry pie concrete dessert for us to try.  The pie is from Suarez Bakery and proceeds go to a local charity, Loaves and Fishes.  If you're not familiar with Shake Shack ask Uncle Google and he can lead you to Wikipedia or some other informative site and you can get the low down. They also have chicken sandwiches, a meat free portabella burger, and other toppings include cherry peppers, Niman Ranch bacon, cheese lettuce, tomato, pickles, etc. Fries can be plain, cheese or bacon and cheese, hot dogs with fixings, and a chicken, apple and sage sausage. On the cool side they have milkshakes, floats, cups and cones and concretes. Drinks include lemonade, iced tea, root beer, fountain soda and assorted beer and wine.   They even have something for dogs, yes dogs! Pooch-ini which is ShackBurger dog biscuits, peanut butter sauce and vanilla custard. Not intended for small dogs it says. It says to just let small dogs have a lick or two. Second on the doggie menu is Bag o' Bones which is 5 ShackBurger dog biscuits. There's a water bowl and a place to "tie" your pooch up while you go inside.  Not sure if they allow dogs in the patio area but only service dogs are allowed inside. I love dogs but I'm not a fan when places allow dogs in the eating areas. Most owners are considerate that not everyone loves dogs nor wants to eat with them but some just seem to be oblivious. So that's it in a nutshell. They will be opening a location in the Blakeney Shopping Center and will be taking over half the space of Bravo which will be shutting down in a few days.  I'm really excited for that and this time I plan to be in line to be in the first 100. I'm ready to go back already. Dinner anyone? That is all!
